Editor's note- Section 2 of Ord. No. 4424-2014, adopted April 7, 2014, deleted the former § 4-4-5, which pertained to deposit of funds; designation of bank; and qualification of bank. Section 3 of the ordinance renumbered § 4-4-6 as a new § 4-4-5. 
ARTICLE 5. - FIRE AND POLICE COMMISSION[1] 

Footnotes: 
--- (1) --- 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 4431-2014, § 1, adopted April 21, 2014, repealed the former Art. 5., §§ 4-5-1-4-5-13, and enacted a new article as set out herein. The former Art. 5 pertained to similar subject matter and derived from Ord. No. 3283-2001, § 2, adopted March 19, 2001; Ord. No. 3366-2002, § 1, adopted Jan. 7, 2002; Ord. No. 3704-2004, § 1, adopted Dec. 20, 2004; Ord. No. 3803-2006, §§ 1-4, adopted Feb. 20, 2006; Ord. No. 4204-2010, § 1, adopted Oct. 4, 2010; Ord. No. 4280-2011, § 1, adopted Nov. 14, 2011; and Ord. No. 4417-2014, § 1, adopted Feb. 17, 2014. 

Sec. 4-5-1. - Adoption of state code. 
    Division 2.1 of state law entitled Board of Fire and Police Commission (65 ILCS 5/10-2.1 et. seq.) as amended is hereby adopted by reference. In case of any conflicts, except for provisions of 65 ILCS 5/10-2.1-6.3, the following provision of this Article 5 shall be given full force and effect and shall prevail. 
(Ord. No. 4431-2014, § 1, 4-21-14) 
Sec. 4-5-2. - Fire and police departments; appointment of members; certificate of appointments. 
    The Board of Fire and Police Commissioners shall appoint all officers and members of the Fire and Police Departments of the municipality except the Chief of Police, Assistant Chief of Police, Fire Chief, Deputy Fire Chief, Assistant Fire Chief and Battalion Chiefs. 
    If a member of the department holding an appointment under this Article is appointed Chief of Police or Assistant Chief of Police or Fire Chief, Deputy Fire Chief, Assistant Fire Chief, or Battalion Chief prior to being eligible to retire on pension, he shall be considered as on furlough from the rank he held immediately prior to his appointment. If he resigns as Chief of Police, Assistant Chief of Police, Fire Chief, Deputy Fire Chief, Assistant Fire Chief, or Battalion Chief or is discharged from such position prior to attaining eligibility to retire on pension, he shall revert to and be established in such prior rank and thereafter be entitled to all the benefits and emoluments of such prior rank, without regard as to whether a vacancy then exists in such rank. 
    The sole authority to issue certificates of appointment to firefighters or patrol officers shall be vested in the Board of Fire and Police Commissioners and all certificates of appointment issued to any officer or member of the Fire or Police Department of a municipality shall be signed by the Chairman and Secretary respectively of the Board of Fire and Police Commissioners of such municipality, upon appointment of such officer or member by action of the Board of Fire and Police Commissioners. 
    This Section 4-5-2 shall supercede 65 ILCS 5/10-2.1-4. 
(Ord. No. 4431-2014, § 1, 4-21-14) 
Sec. 4-5-3. - Application fee. 
    All applicants for original appointments to the Fire and Police Departments shall pay a $40, non-refundable application fee to cover the costs of the application and testing process. 
(Ord. No. 4431-2014, § 1, 4-21-14) 
Sec. 4-5-4. - Age of retirement. 
    The age of retirement for police officers and firefighters is sixty-two (62) years. No police officer or firefighter shall be employed past their 62 nd birthday. 
(Ord. No. 4431-2014, § 1, 4-21-14) 
Sec. 4-5-5. - Preference points for firefighters. 
    The Fire and Police Commission will award a maximum of five (5) preference points each for paragraphs (1), (3) and (5) of 65 ILCS 5/10-2.1-6.3(h). The Fire and Police Commission will award zero (0) preference points for paragraphs (2), (4), (6) and (7) of 65 ILCS 5/10-2.1-6.3(h). 
(Ord. No. 4431-2014, § 1, 4-21-14) 
Sec. 4-5-6. - Eligibility for firefighters. 
    In order to be eligible to take the written exam as referenced in 65 ILCS 5/10-2.1-6.3, the applicants must provide proof of licensure as a State of Illinois Emergency Medical Technician - Paramedic (EMT-P) and proof of passing the physical ability requirement contained in 65 ILCS 5/10-2.1-6.3(f) by presenting evidence of successfully passing CPAT with ladder climbing within the past year. 
(Ord. No. 4431-2014, § 1, 4-21-14) 
Sec. 4-5-7. - Eligibility score for firefighters. 
    In order to comply with voluntary affirmative action goals of the Village and to ensure a sufficient number of qualified applicants, the preliminary eligibility register as referenced in 65 ILCS 5/10-2.1-6.3 shall be composed of those applicants who have achieved a score of 70 or above on the written exam or whose score is at or above the median score for all applicants participating in the written exam, whichever score is lower. 
(Ord. No. 4431-2014, § 1, 4-21-14) 
Sec. 4-5-8. - Requirements for police officers. 
    All new applicants to the Police Department, without exception, shall: 1) have a bachelor's degree from an institution of higher education certified by a regional or national accreditation agency as a prerequisite for employment; 2) be over 21 years of age and less than 35 years of age; 3) have vision minimum corrected to 20-20 with no color blindness; 4) be a United States citizen; 5) have a valid driver's license; and 6) understand the written and spoken English language. 
(Ord. No. 4431-2014, § 1, 4-21-14) 
Sec. 4-5-9. - Requirements for firefighters. 
    All new applicants to the Fire Department, without exception, shall: 1) not be 35 years of age or older; 2) have vision minimum corrected to 20-20 with no color blindness; 3) have minimum, non-corrected hearing ability to perform as a firefighter; 4) be a United States citizen; 5) have a valid driver's license; and 6) understand the written and spoken English language. 
(Ord. No. 4431-2014, § 1, 4-21-14) 
Sec. 4-5-10. - Additional requirements for both police officers and firefighters. 
    All candidates shall be required to submit themselves to a polygraph examination conducted by a certified polygraphist as the Board may direct and at such time as the Board shall direct prior to appointment. 
    All candidates shall be required to submit themselves to an additional psychological examination conducted by a licensed psychologist as the Board may direct and at such time as the Board shall direct prior to appointment. Failure to pass this examination shall eliminate the candidate's name from the "Eligibility Register" and any further consideration. 
    All candidates shall be required to submit themselves to a medical examination by a physician designated by the Commission. Failure to pass this examination shall eliminate the candidate's name from the "Eligibility Register" and any further consideration. 
    All candidates shall be required to submit themselves to a background check to the satisfaction of the Board. Failure to pass this background check shall eliminate the candidate's name from the eligibility list and any further consideration. 
(Ord. No. 4431-2014, § 1, 4-21-14) 
Sec. 4-5-11. - Firefighter training. 
    An original firefighter appointee shall complete the Illinois Fire Protection and Training Act approved training course and obtain State certification as either a Certified Firefighter II or Basic Operations Firefighter and Hazardous Materials First Responder - Operations within twelve (12) months of his/her original appointment. An original firefighter appointee, at the option of the Fire Department, shall complete either his/her Advanced Certified Firefighter III certification and the Fire Apparatus Engineer certification or the Advanced Technician Firefighter course completion and the Fire Apparatus course completion within five (5) years of original appointment. Failure to obtain such certification and/or course completion shall be cause for discharge. 
(Ord. No. 4431-2014, § 1, 4-21-14) 
Sec. 4-5-12. - Temporary appointments. 
    In order to prevent a stoppage of public business, to meet extraordinary exigencies, or to prevent material impairment of either the Police or Fire Department, the Board may make temporary appointments, to remain in force until regular appointments may be made under the provisions of this Article. No such appointment of any member shall exceed 90 consecutive days or more than 183 days in any calendar year. This Section 4-5-12 shall supercede 65 ILCS 5/10-2.1-16. 
(Ord. No. 4431-2014, § 1, 4-21-14) 
Sec. 4-5-13. - Residency requirements for police officers. 
    To become certified and to remain certified as a full-time member of the Police Department, the prospective member, or member of the Police Department, shall live within a forty-five (45) mile radius of the corporate boundaries of the Village of Hoffman Estates and shall move the aforesaid distance within one (1) year after the end of their probationary period. 
(Ord. No. 4431-2014, § 1, 4-21-14) 
ARTICLE 6. - CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS BOARD[2] 

Footnotes: 
--- (2) --- 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 3564-2003, § 1, approved Oct. 20, 2003, amended art. 6 to read as herein set out. Formerly, said article pertained to similar subject matter. 

Sec. 4-6-1. - Capital Improvements Board. 
    There is hereby created the Capital Improvements Board of the Village of Hoffman Estates. 
(Ord. No. 3564-2003, § 1, 10-20-03) 
Sec. 4-6-2. - Membership. 
    The Capital Improvements Board shall consist of nine members, one of whom shall be a chairman. 
(Ord. No. 3564-2003, § 1, 10-20-03) 
Sec. 4-6-3. - Members. 
    There shall be nine members of the Capital Improvements Board. The members of said Board shall include the Village Trustee serving as the Chairman of the Finance Committee, the Village Trustee serving as the Chairman of the Public Works Committee, and seven members who each shall be either a resident of the community or a business person in the community appointed by the Village President with advice and consent of the Board of Trustees. Such seven members shall serve for two-year terms, three expiring on December 31 of even years and four expiring on December 31 of odd years. 
(Ord. No. 3564-2003, § 1, 10-20-03; Ord. No. 4188-2010, § 1, 7-6-10) 
Sec. 4-6-4. - Chairman. 
    The Chairman of the Capital Improvements Board shall be the Chairman of the Finance Committee. 
(Ord. No. 3564-2003, § 1, 10-20-03; Ord. No. 4188-2010, § 2, 7-6-10) 
Sec. 4-6-5. - Terms of office. 
    Members shall serve so long as they continue in their elected or appointed position except that the citizen members shall serve for a term of two (2) years. 
(Ord. No. 3564-2003, § 1, 10-20-03) 
Sec. 4-6-6. - Duties. 
    [The Capital Improvements Board shall:] 
A.  Recommend needs of public structures in terms of expansion and new construction. 
B.  Recommend plans for rebuilding of roadways within the Village. 
C.  Recommend priorities of capital construction needs including timetables, scope of work and financing considerations. 
(Ord. No. 3564-2003, § 1, 10-20-03) 
Sec. 4-6-7. - Meetings. 
    The Capital Improvements Board shall meet quarterly and as deemed necessary by the chairman. 
(Ord. No. 3564-2003, § 1, 10-20-03) 
Sec. 4-6-8. - Reports. 
    The Chairman of the Capital Improvements Board shall submit to the President and Board a written report of the activities of said Board on an annual basis in October of each year. The Board shall keep a written record of all official meetings. 
(Ord. No. 3564-2003, § 1, 10-20-03) 
ARTICLE 7. - VILLAGE MANAGER 

Sec. 4-7-1. - Office created. 
    There is hereby created the office of Village Manager. 
Sec. 4-7-2. - Appointment. 
    The Village Manager shall be appointed by a majority vote of the President and Board of Trustees voting jointly. He shall be appointed for an indefinite term. No elected official of the Village of Hoffman Estates shall be appointed to the office of Village Manager during the term of the office for which he was elected. During the absence or disability of the Village Manager, the President shall act or appoint someone as Acting Village Manager to perform the duties of the office. 
    The Village Manager shall be chosen exclusively on the basis of administrative and executive abilities. 
    Applicants for Village Manager shall be interviewed by the President and Board of Trustees and the appointment as Village Manager will be contingent upon the applicant's signing a letter of agreement regarding "conditions of employment" that will be negotiated between the applicant and the President and Board of Trustees. Such a letter shall be approved by the President and Board of Trustees voting jointly. 
    At the time of appointment, the Village Manager need not be a resident of the Village of Hoffman Estates. During the tenure of the appointment, the Village Manager shall reside in Hoffman Estates, or in close proximity thereof, if so provided in the letter of agreement regarding "conditions of employment". The Village Manager will be granted one year from the date of employment to comply with the terms of this sub-section or face removal. 
Sec. 4-7-3. - Removal from office. 
    The Village Manager may at any time be removed from office by a majority vote of the President and Board of Trustees. At least ten days before such removal becomes effective, the President and Board of Trustees shall furnish the Manager with a written statement setting forth its intention to remove him, and the reasons therefore. If requested by the Village Manager, the President and Board of Trustees shall grant him a public hearing during this ten day period. 
Sec. 4-7-4. - Powers and duties. 
    The Village Manager shall be the chief administrative officer of the Village. All Departments shall report to the Village Manager. He shall be responsible to the President and Board of Trustees for the proper administration of all affairs of the Village. The powers and duties of the Village Manager shall be: 
A.  To exercise control of all Departments of the Village and divisions thereof. 
B.  To hire and, when necessary for the good of the Village, suspend or remove all employees of the Village except as otherwise provided by the Municipal Code or the Illinois Compiled Statutes. 
C.  All Department Heads and any other positions designated by this Code or ordinances to come under the provisions of this sub-section C., shall be hired by the Village Manager. 
Upon discharging any employee hired under this section 4-7-4, the Village Manager shall submit to the President and Board of Trustees at the next meeting following such removal a statement concerning said removal and the reasons therefor. 
D.  Before the annual Budget Ordinance is prepared by the corporate authorities, he shall prepare or cause to be prepared and submit to the corporate authorities a report of his estimate as nearly as may be of the money necessary to defray the expenses of the Village during the next fiscal year, and in said report he shall classify and detail the purpose of expenditure, the aggregate income of the preceding fiscal year, the Village liabilities, and such other information as is necessary to assist the President and Board of Trustees to adopt a Budget Ordinance, and shall be responsible for its administration after adoption. 
E.  For the purpose of preparing the aforesaid estimate, he is authorized to require all officers to submit statements of their respective offices or Departments, a description of proposed Village improvements, and the probable expense thereof, a description of all unperformed contracts and a statement of the amount of all unexpired appropriations of the preceding year. 
F.  Recommend to the President and Board of Trustees, from time to time, adoption of such measures as he may deem necessary or expedient for the health, safety or welfare of the community or for the improvement of administrative services. 
G.  Consolidate or combine offices, positions, departments, or units under his jurisdiction, with the approval of the President and Board of Trustees. 
H.  Attend all meetings of the President and Board of Trustees unless excused therefrom and take part in the discussion of all matters coming before the Board. He shall be entitled to notice of all regular and special meetings of the President and Board of Trustees. 
I.  Purchase all materials, supplies and equipment for which funds are provided in the budget for amounts up to and including $20,000.00. For expenditure in excess of $5,000.00 and up to $20,000.00, the Village Manager shall secure, when feasible, at least three quotations before making purchases and if called upon by the Board of Trustees be prepared to present the quotations. For expenditures in excess of $5,000.00 and up to $20,000.00, where three quotations are not received, the matter shall be presented to the Board of Trustees, except upon an emergency or exigent circumstance but a poll of the corporate authorities with at least four members in support shall be required prior to such emergency or exigent expenditure and presentation to the Board of Trustees. A local business preference of two percent shall be applied to such quotations or any other expenditures less than $20,000.00. For the purpose of evaluating the lowest responsible quotation, the actual award shall be made in the amount of the original quotation. The Village Manager shall receive sealed bids for purchases or contracts in excess of $20,000.00 and present them to the Board of Trustees for approval and advise the Board on the advantages or disadvantages of contract and bid proposals. No purchase shall be made, contract let or obligation incurred for any item or service which exceeds the current working budget without prior approval by the Board of Trustees. No contract in excess of $20,000.00 and no contract for new construction shall be let except by the Board of Trustees. The Village Manager may issue such rules governing purchasing procedures within the administrative organization as the Board of Trustees shall approve. 
J.  To enforce the laws and ordinances within the Village. He may sign complaints in the name of the Village for violations of laws and ordinances, and shall attend as witness before the court where a trial may be had on such complaints. 
K.  To inquire carefully into the affairs of all Departments of the Village, or any division thereof. Investigate all complaints in relation to matters concerning the administration of the government of the Village, and see that all franchises, permits and privileges granted by the Village are faithfully observed. 
L.  The Village Manager shall devote his full time to the performance of his duties and shall not engage in any other employment without the consent of the President and Board of Trustees. 
M.  Perform such other duties as may be assigned to him by the President and Board of Trustees, not inconsistent with the Municipal Code or Illinois Compiled Statutes. 
(Ord. No. 3755-2005, § 3, 9-6-05; Ord. No. 3951-2007, § 1, 8-20-07; Ord. No. 4309-2012, § 1, 5-14-12) 
Sec. 4-7-5. - Board not to interfere with hiring or removing. 
    Neither the President nor the Board of Trustees shall interfere with the hiring and removal from office of any person by the Village Manager, except those appointments covered by the Municipal Code, Ordinances or the Illinois Revised Statutes. Salary, prerequisites of employment and "conditions of employment" of all department heads and any other positions designated by the Municipal Code or Section 4-7-4-C of this article shall be subject to approval of the President and Board of Trustees voting jointly. The President and Board shall deal with administrative services when practical through the Village Manager. Neither the President nor the Board of Trustees shall interfere with the administrative function of the Village. 
Sec. 4-7-6. - Emergencies. 
    In case of accident, disaster or other circumstances creating a public emergency, the Village Manager may award contracts and make purchases for the purpose of meeting said emergency, however, he shall file promptly with the President and the Board of Trustees a certificate showing such emergency and the necessity for such action, together with an itemized account of all expenditures. 
Sec. 4-7-7. - Bond. 
    The Village Manager shall furnish a surety bond in the amount of $5,000.00 to be approved by the Board of Trustees, said bond to be conditioned on the faithful performance of his duties; the premium of the bond shall be paid by the Village. 
Sec. 4-7-8. - Compensation. 
    The Village Manager shall receive such compensation as is fixed by the President and Board of Trustees. 
ARTICLE 8. - PLANNING AND ZONING COMMISSION[3] 

Footnotes: 
--- (3) --- 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 1, adopted May, 2, 2011, effective June 7, 2011, renamed Art. 8, Title from "Plan Commission" to "Planning and Zoning Commission." 

Sec. 4-8-1. - Creation, composition. 
    A Planning and Zoning Commission of 11 persons, composed of a chairman and ten other members, is created for the Village of Hoffman Estates. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 1, 5-2-11) 
Sec. 4-8-2. - Appointments, terms of members, vacancies, removals. 
    The President with the advice and consent of the Board of Trustees shall appoint a chairman and ten other members to the Planning and Zoning Commission. Initial terms will be staggered; the chairman and five other members shall be appointed for a term expiring April 30, 2012, with subsequent terms to be four years. The remaining five members shall be appointed for a term expiring April 30, 2014, with subsequent terms to be four years. When vacancies occur in the Planning and Zoning Commission, the President with the advice and consent of the Board of Trustees, shall fill said vacancies by appointment, for the remainder of the unexpired term. All members of the Planning and Zoning Commission must be residents of the Village of Hoffman Estates. Members of the Planning and Zoning Commission can be removed from the Commission at any time by a two-thirds vote of the Village's Corporate Authority. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 1, 5-2-11) 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 1, adopted May 2, 2011, renamed § 4-8-2 from "Appointments, terms of members, vacancies" to "Appointments, terms of members, vacancies removals". 
Sec. 4-8-3. - Chairman, minutes, rules and regulations. 
A.  All meetings of the Planning and Zoning Commission shall be held at the call of the chairman and at such times as such Commission may determine. 
B.  All meetings conducted by such Commission shall be open to the public. Any person may appear and testify at a hearing, either in person or by duly authorized agent or attorney. 
C.  The Commission shall keep minutes of its proceedings showing the vote of each member upon each question, or if absent or failing to vote, indicating such fact, and shall also keep records of its hearings and other official actions. 
D.  The Commission shall adopt its own rules of procedure not in conflict with this Code or with the applicable State statutes or with Chapter 9 of the Hoffman Estates Municipal Code. 
E.  The Chairman shall decide all questions of order, and in all cases not covered by this Commission's rules, the Commission shall be governed by parliamentary law as laid down in Robert's Rules of Order. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 1, 5-2-11) 
Sec. 4-8-4. - General duties and powers. 
A.  To hear and decide appeals from any order, requirements, decision or determination made by the Director of Code Enforcement or the Assistant Village Manager-Development Services under Chapter 9 of the Hoffman Estates Municipal Code. 
B.  To conduct hearings upon all applications for variations, special uses and text amendments in the manner and subject to the standards prescribed in Chapter 9 of this Code and to report its findings and recommendations to the Village Board. 
C.  To hear and make recommendations to the President and Board of Trustees on all matters referred to it or upon which it is required to act under Chapter 9 of the Hoffman Estates Municipal Code. 
D.  To prepare and recommend to the Corporate Authorities a plan or plans for the development and/or redevelopment of the Village and contiguous unincorporated territory not more than one and one-half miles beyond the corporate limits of the Village and not included in any other municipality. The plan or plans when adopted by the Corporate Authorities shall be designed as the official plan, or part thereof, of the Village. Such plan or plans may be adopted in whole or in separate geographical or functional parts, each of which, when adopted by the Village's Corporate Authority shall be the official plan, or part thereof, of the Village. Thereafter, from time to time, the Planning and Zoning Commission may recommend changes in the official plan or any part thereof. To provide for the health, safety, comfort and convenience of the inhabitants of the Village and contiguous territory, such plan or plans may establish reasonable standards of design for subdivisions and for re-subdivisions of unimproved land and of areas subject to redevelopment, including reasonable requirements for public streets, alleys, ways for public service facilities, storm or floodwater runoff channels and basins, landscaping site design and operational requirements, parks, playgrounds, school grounds, other public grounds. 
E.  To prepare and recommend to the Corporate Authorities from time to time, plans for specific improvements in pursuance of the official plan. 
F.  To give aid to the municipal officials charged with the direction of projects for improvements embraced within the official plan, to further the making of these projects, and generally to promote the realization of the official plan. 
G.  To exercise such other powers, germane to the powers granted by this Article, as may be conferred by this Code. 
H.  To conduct hearings and make findings and recommendations in matters brought before said Commission concerning amendments of zoning regulations and zoning districts in accordance with the provisions of this Code and the Statutes of the State of Illinois. 
I.  To hear and make recommendations to the President and Board of Trustees on all matters referred to it or upon which it is required to act under this Code. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 1, 5-2-11) 
Sec. 4-8-5. - Compensation of members. 
    The members of the Planning and Zoning Commission shall receive such compensation as deemed appropriate by the President and Board of Trustees from time to time as provided by Resolution of the President and Board of Trustees. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 1, 5-2-11) 
Sec. 4-8-6. - Majority. 
    A majority of the members of the Planning and Zoning Commission shall constitute a quorum. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 1, 5-2-11)

ARTICLE 10. - EMERGENCY TELEPHONE SYSTEM BOARD (REPEALED) 
Chapter 5 - VILLAGE ADMINISTRATION 
ARTICLE 1. - DEPARTMENT OF FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES 

Sec. 5-1-1. - Department established. 
    There is hereby established an Administrative Department of the Municipal Government of the Village of Hoffman Estates which shall be known as the Department of Finance. 
Sec. 5-1-2. - Director of Finance. 
    There is hereby created the office of Director of Finance, who shall have the management, control and supervision over all employees assigned to this Department subject to the supervision of the Village Manager. The Director of Finance shall be appointed by and serve at the pleasure of the Village Manager and shall be under the direct supervision of the Village Manager. The Director of Finance shall perform all such duties as enumerated in the Municipal Code or other Village ordinances, and such other duties as may be assigned or required by the Village Manager. 
(Ord. No. 4424-2014, § 4, 4-7-14) 
Sec. 5-1-3. - Duties and functions, generally. 
    The Director of Finance shall be charged with preparing and keeping all financial records of the Village. Subject to the supervision of the Village Manager, the Director of Finance shall make all purchases of materials, supplies, or equipment for the Village in the manner provided by law, ordinance and rules and regulations of the Village. 
    The Director of Finance shall be responsible for developing and maintaining an appropriate property control inventory of all properties owned or belonging to the Village. The Director of Finance shall be responsible for disposing of all unusable property in the Village in a manner as directed by law, ordinance, rules and regulations of the Village. The Director of Finance shall keep accounts showing at all times the fiscal condition of the Village, including the current and anticipated revenues and expenses of all municipal funds and accounts. 
    The Director of Finance shall prepare and keep for the Village Treasurer all bond registers and other records required by law to be kept by the Treasurer and shall prepare for signature and publication the Annual Treasurer's Report and any other report required by law. 
    The Director of Finance, under Village Treasurer's authority, shall prepare each month a warrant of the Treasurer for the payment of all sums due from the Village, listing each item and the account number out of which it is payable; which warrant when properly approved by the President and Board of Trustees shall authorize the issuance of a voucher or check as provided by law or ordinance for the payment of each item. Approval of such list of items to be paid by the President and Board of Trustees on a roll-call vote shall constitute the President's and Board of Trustees' approval of the payment of all expenses listed thereon; provided that the President and Board of Trustees may, in motion to approve payment, except specific items from such approval, in which case such items shall not be paid. 
    The Director of Finance, at the Village Treasurer's direction, shall receive and collect all license fees, permit fees, charges for municipal utility service, charges for the use of Village property, or special services rendered by the Village, sums due the Village on any contracts, and all other sums due the Village other than those which are by law paid directly to the Treasurer. 
    It shall be the duty of the Director of Finance to keep the Village Manager and Corporate Authorities informed as to all sums due on taxes and all other revenues to which the Village is entitled. 
    It shall be the responsibility of the Director of Finance in cooperation with other Village Department Heads to prepare preliminary budget drafts for each fiscal year and submit same to the Village Manager for his review and further action. 
    It shall be the responsibility of the Director of Finance to prepare and submit to the Village Manager the annual Budget Act Ordinance and Tax Levy Ordinances for the Village. 
    The Director of Finance, in cooperation with the Village Treasurer, shall be responsible for supervising the annual audit of all Village funds and shall give full cooperation to the Village auditors so designated as prescribed by law and ordinances. 
    The Director of Finance shall be responsible for preparing payroll checks for all employees of the Village on a regular basis; such payroll being based upon employees' timesheets approved by the appropriate department heads utilizing the rates of pay approved by the Village. 
    The Director of Finance shall be responsible for advising the Village Manager and the Corporate Authorities on all matters related to the issuance of debt obligations. Such responsibilities include coordinating the issuance of new debt, restructuring existing debt as appropriate, and making all debt service payments on a timely basis. 
    The Director of Finance, in cooperation with the Village Treasurer, shall be responsible for the preparation of the annual financial report of the Village. 
(Ord. No. 4424-2014, § 5, 4-7-14) 
Sec. 5-1-4. - Vacation of office. 
    The Village Manager shall serve as ex-officio Director of Finance until a separate appointment is made to fill such office. 
ARTICLE 2. - DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES 

Sec. 5-2-1. - Department established. 
    There is hereby established an Administrative Department of the Municipal Government of the Village of Hoffman Estates which shall be known as the Department of Health and Human Services. 
Sec. 5-2-2. - Director of Health and Human Services. 
    There is hereby created the office of Director of Health and Human Services, who shall have the management, control and supervision over all employees assigned to this Department subject to the supervision of the Village Manager. He shall be appointed by and serve at the pleasure of the Village Manager and shall be under the direct supervision of the Village Manager. He shall perform all such duties as enumerated in the Municipal Code or other Village ordinances, and such other duties as may be assigned or required of him by the Village Manager. 
Sec. 5-2-3. - Duties and functions, generally. 
    The Director of Health and Human Services shall cause to be initiated plans for dealing with health problems not already included in the public health programs. 
    The Director of Health and Human Services or his designate, shall attend all Commission meetings which have a formal relationship with the Department of Health and Human Services and he shall keep said Commissions informed as to general social and health matters. 
    The Director of Health and Human Services shall cause to be developed and maintained appropriate professional services, programs and consultation for the residents of the Village with the goal of maintaining or improving the physical health and psychological functioning of individuals and families. 
    The Director of Health and Human Services shall be responsible for recommending to the Village Manager comprehensive, and/or specific, programs of human resources and/or social services to meet the needs of all residents within the Village. 
    The Director of Health and Human Services shall provide professional health and human services required to implement legislation, rules and regulations of the state, county and municipality relating to the maintenance and protection of the health and social well-being of Village residents. 
Sec. 5-2-4. - Division of health services. 
    There is hereby created the Division of Health Services which shall be a division of the Department of Health and Human Services. 
Sec. 5-2-5. - Division of Human services. 
    There is hereby created the Division of Human Services which shall be a division of the Department of Health and Human Services. 
Sec. 5-2-6. - Vacation of office. 
    The Village Manager shall serve as ex-officio Director of Health and Human Services until a separate appointment is made to fill such office. 
ARTICLE 3. - DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC WORKS 

Sec. 5-3-1. - Department established. 
    There is hereby established an Administrative Department of the municipal government of the Village of Hoffman Estates which shall be known as the Department of Public Works. 
Sec. 5-3-2. - Director of Public Works. 
    There is hereby created the office of Director of Public Works, who shall have the management, control and supervision over all employees assigned to this Department subject to the supervision of the Village Manager. He shall be appointed by and serve at the pleasure of the Village Manager and shall be under the direct supervision of the Village Manager. He shall perform all such duties as enumerated in the Municipal Code or other Village ordinances, and such other duties as may be assigned or required of him by the Village Manager. 
Sec. 5-3-3. - Duties and functions, generally. 
    The Director of Public Works shall have charge of and supervision over all public property of the Village, including all streets, parks, parkways, public rights-of-way, traffic control devices, public trees and plants, sidewalks, municipal buildings, street lighting system, water system, sanitary sewer system, storm sewer system, public drainageways and other property of the Village not specifically assigned to some other officer or department. 
    The Director of Public Works shall also have charge of and be responsible for the condition of all motor vehicles, trucks and other equipment of the Village not specifically assigned to another officer or department. 
Sec. 5-3-4. - Bond. 
    The Director of Public Works shall, before entering upon the duties of the office, furnish surety bond to the Village in such amount and form as the Board of Trustees shall approve, conditioned upon the faithful performance of the duties of his office. The premium of such bond shall be paid by the Village. 
Sec. 5-3-5. - Vacation of office. 
    The Village Manager or his designate shall serve as ex-officio Director of Public Works if the office is vacant until a separate appointment is made to fill such office. 
ARTICLE 4. - DEPARTMENT OF DEVELOPMENT SERVICES[1] 

Footnotes:

Editor's note- Ord. No. 3793-2006, § 1, adopted Jan. 3, 2006, amended Article 4 in its entirety to read as herein set out. Formerly, said Article was entitled Department of Community Development. See the Code Comparative Table for a detailed analysis of amendment.

The Department of Development Services shall include divisions of Planning, Code Enforcement, Economic Development, Engineering and Transportation. 
(Ord. No. 3793-2006, § 1, 1-3-06)

He shall be appointed by and serve at the pleasure of the Village Manager and shall be under direct supervision of the Village Manager. He shall perform all such duties as enumerated in the Municipal Code or other Village ordinances, and such other duties as may be assigned or required of him by the Village Manager. 
(Ord. No. 3793-2006, § 1, 1-3-06)

    The Assistant Village Manager-Development Services shall assure that assigned areas of responsibility are performed within budget; perform cost control activities; monitor revenues and expenditures in assigned area to assure sound fiscal control; prepare annual budget requests; assure effective and efficient use of budgeted funds, personnel, materials, facilities and time. 
    The Assistant Village Manager-Development Services shall supervise the development and implementation of growth management, land use, economic development, utility, housing, transportation, solid waste or other plans and codes to meet the Village's needs and any intergovernmental agreements or requirements. 
(Ord. No. 3793-2006, § 1, 1-3-06) 
Sec. 5-4-4. - Vacation of office. 
    The Village Manager shall serve as ex-officio Assistant Village Manager-Development Services until a separate appointment is made to fill the position of Assistant Village Manager for Development Services. 
(Ord. No. 3793-2006, § 1, 1-3-06) 
ARTICLE 5. - POLICE DEPARTMENT 

Sec. 5-5-1. - Department established. 
    There is hereby established an Administrative Department of the Municipal Government of the Village of Hoffman Estates which shall be known as the Police Department. 
Sec. 5-5-2. - Chief of Police. 
    There is hereby established the office of Chief of Police, who shall have the management, control and supervision over all employees assigned to this Department, subject to the supervision of the Village Manager. He shall be appointed by and serve at the pleasure of the Village Manager and shall be under the direct supervision of the Village Manager. He shall perform all such duties as enumerated in the Municipal Code, State Statutes, or other Village ordinances, and other duties as may be assigned or required of him by the Village Manager. 
The position requirement for the position of Chief of Police shall be as follows: 
A.  Residency. Residence in the Village of Hoffman Estates within twelve (12) months after appointment unless such time is extended by the Village Manager for good cause. 
B.  Education or experience. The Chief of Police is required to possess skills, knowledge, and a Bachelor's Degree in police science, public administration or related field, or a minimum of five years progressively responsible supervisory experience in a command capacity in police field including extended experience in management, supervision, and command of a police organization, or both. 
C.  Knowledge, ability and skills. The Chief of Police shall possess extensive knowledge of the principals and practices of modern police administration including the methods and standards by which professional police services are evaluated. 
Thorough knowledge of pertinent federal and state statutes and municipal ordinances. 
Thorough knowledge of police administration, investigations, tactical forces, traffic details, emergency command operations, training techniques and all related aspects of police services. 
Considerable knowledge of police vehicles, equipment, tools, telecommunications devices and related materials common to the police service. 
Considerable knowledge in supervisory techniques and ability to apply this knowledge in a union environment. 
Ability to organize and administer a comprehensive program of public safety in the police department component. 
Ability to skillfully uphold and implement Village policies; direct departmental staff in order to maximize the delivery and coordination of public services. 
Ability to tactfully and professionally direct subordinates; to develop departmental, divisional and employee goals and objectives in accordance with the mission of the Village; to measure success of goals and professionally evaluate employee performance. 
Ability to problem solve, plan, implement and evaluate departmental programs. 
Ability to comprehend complex organizational and service delivery issues and to make decisions in accordance with the best interest of the Village. 
Ability to coordinate the enforcement of Federal, State and Village laws with respect to the police department. 
Ability to budget in accordance with municipal and departmental goals and to maintain budgetary compliance. 
Unusual ability to communicate with the public, Village officials and other employees and departments in routine and stressful situations. 
Physical ability to perform successfully in the position. 
(Ord. No. 3761-2005, § 1, 9-19-05) 
Sec. 5-5-3. - Duties and responsibilities. 
    The Chief of Police shall have control and management of all matters and things pertaining to the Police Department, and all officers and employees. 
    The Chief of Police shall prepare and submit to the Village Manager an estimate of the total cost and expense of providing for and maintaining the Police Department of the Village during the ensuing fiscal year, which estimates shall be submitted in the form and time required by the Village Manager. 
    On or before May 31 of each year, the Chief of Police shall prepare and submit to the Village Manager an annual report which will include a listing of all police-related incidents that may have taken place in the Village during the preceding fiscal year. 
    The Chief of Police shall be the keeper of the Village jail, and shall have custody of all persons incarcerated therein. 
    The Chief of Police shall keep such records and make such reports concerning the activities of the Department as may be required by State statute, local ordinance, or as may be directed by the Village Manager. 
    The Chief of Police shall be responsible for the performance by the Police Department of all its functions, and all persons who are members of the Department shall serve subject to the orders of the Chief of Police. 
    The Chief of Police shall be the custodian of all lost, abandoned or stolen property in the Village. 
    The Chief of Police shall be authorized to serve writs, summons, and other processes, but no Police officer shall serve any such summons or process except on the order of the Chief of Police. 
    The Chief of Police shall keep records of the names of all persons arrested, all persons committed to the Village jail, and all accidents which occur upon the public way within the Village limits. 
    The Chief of Police shall develop and implement a regular training schedule for the members of the Department and shall authorize, when he deems appropriate, members of the Department to attend approved police courses, such programs to be with the approval of the Village Manager. 
    The President and Board of Trustees shall have the authority to approve and disapprove any major changes in the manner the Hoffman Estates Police Department provides police service and reductions of personnel. The Chief of Police will submit proposed changes to the President and Board of Trustees and will comply with the advice and consent of the President and Board of Trustees. 
Sec. 5-5-4. - Rules and regulations. 
    The Chief of Police may make or describe such rules and regulations for the guidance of the members of the Department as he shall see fit, such rules and regulations shall be binding on such members. 
Sec. 5-5-5. - Power of arrest. 
    The members of the Police Department are hereby authorized to arrest, with or without process or on view, any person who shall break the peace or be found breaking any state law or ordinance of the Village of Hoffman Estates and to take such person before a competent tribunal, or if necessary, detain such person in custody in the Police Station, Village jail, or any other safe place, until they can be brought before the proper court. 
Sec. 5-5-6. - Exempt rank. 
A.  The Village Manager shall be and he is hereby authorized to appoint upon the recommendation of the Chief of Police, two Assistant Chiefs of Police who shall serve at the pleasure of the Village Manager. Such appointment shall be on probation for 12 months. 
B.  The Chief of Police is hereby authorized to discipline or suspend up to ten days subject to the provisions of the Hoffman Estates Staff Policy Manual. The Village Manager, upon the recommendation of the Chief of Police, may discharge subject to the provisions of the Hoffman Estates Staff Policy Manual any or all of the persons holding the position of Assistant Chief of Police, who hold no permanent rank in the Police Department as established under the Illinois Board of Fire and Police Commissioners Act or Section 4-6 of the Hoffman Estates Municipal Code. The Chief of Police may file charges for discharge before the Hoffman Estates Fire and Police Commission any or all persons holding the position of Assistant Chief of Police, who hold permanent rank in the Police Department as established under the Illinois Board of Fire and Police Commissioners Act or Section 5-6 of the Hoffman Estates Municipal Code. 
Sec. 5-5-7. - Sworn personnel. 
    The sworn personnel of the Police Department shall consist of one Chief of Police; two Assistant Chiefs of Police; six reduced to five upon attrition) Lieutenants; 14 (reduced to 11 upon attrition) Sergeants and 74 Patrol Officers. 
(Ord. No. 3379-2002, § 1, 2-18-02; Ord. No. 3516-2003, § 1, 5-12-03; Ord. No. 3537, § 1, 7-21-03; Ord. No. 3607-2004, § 1, 3-15-04; Ord. No. 3631-2004, § 1, 6-7-04; Ord. No. 3750-2005, § 1, 9-6-05; Ord. No. 3788-2005, § 1, 12-19-05; Ord. No. 3902-2007, § 1, 2-19-07; Ord. No. 3991, § 1, 12-10-07; Ord. No. 4060-2008, § 1, 10-20-08; Ord. No. 4119, § 1, 5-15-09; Ord. No. 4166-2010, § 1, 2-1-10; Ord. No. 4187-2010, § 1, 7-6-10) 
Sec. 5-5-8. - Reserved. 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 3520-2003, § 1, adopted June 2, 2003, repealed § 5-5-8 in its entirety. Formerly, said section pertained to vacation of office. 
ARTICLE 6. - FIRE DEPARTMENT[2] 

Footnotes: 
--- (2) --- 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 3796-2005, § 1, adopted Feb. 6, 2006 amended Article 6 in its entirety to read as herein set out. Formerly, said Article pertained to similar subject matter. See the Code Comparative Table for a detailed analysis of amendment. 

Sec. 5-6-1. - Department established. 
    There is hereby established an Administrative Department of the Municipal Government of the Village of Hoffman Estates which shall be known as the Fire Department. 
(Ord. No. 3796-2006, § 1, 2-6-06) 
Sec. 5-6-2. - Fire Chief. 
    There is hereby established the office of Fire Chief, who shall have the management, control and supervision over all employees assigned to this Department, subject to the supervision of the Village Manager. He shall be appointed by and serve at the pleasure of the Village Manager and shall be under the direct supervision of the Village Manager. He shall perform all such duties as enumerated in the Municipal Code, State statutes, or other Village ordinances, and such other duties as may be assigned or required of him by the Village Manager. 
    The position requirement for the position of Fire Chief shall be as follows: 
A.  Residency. Residence in the Village of Hoffman Estates within 12 months after appointment unless such time is extended by the Village Manager for good cause. 
B.  Education or Experience. The Fire Chief is required to possess skills, knowledge and a Bachelor's Degree in fire science, public administration or related field or a minimum of five years progressively responsible supervisory experience in a command capacity in fire suppression including extended experience in management, supervision, and a command of a fire organization, or both. 
C.  Knowledge, Ability and Skills. The Fire Chief shall possess extensive knowledge of the principals and practices of modern fire administration including the methods and standards by which professional fire services are evaluated. 
Thorough knowledge of pertinent federal and state statutes and municipal ordinances. 
Thorough knowledge of fire sciences, emergency medical services, fire prevention, fire ground command operations, training techniques and all related aspects of fire services. 
Considerable knowledge of fire apparatus, equipment, tools, telecommunications devices and related materials common to the fire service. 
Considerable knowledge in supervisory techniques and ability to apply this knowledge in a union environment. 
Considerable ability to command fire suppression activities, emergency medical incidents and related activities. 
Ability to organize and administer a comprehensive program of public safety in the fire department component. 
Ability to skillfully uphold and implement Village policies; direct departmental staff in order to maximize the delivery and coordination of public services. 
Ability to tactfully and professionally direct subordinates; to develop departmental, divisional and employee goals and objectives in accordance with the mission of the Village; to measure success of goals and professionally evaluate employee performance. 
Ability to problem solve, plan, implement and evaluate departmental programs. 
Ability to comprehend complex organizational and service delivery issues and to make decisions in accordance with the best interest of the Village. 
Ability to coordinate the enforcement of federal, state and Village laws with respect to the fire department. 
Ability to budget in accordance with municipal and departmental goals and to maintain budgetary compliance. 
Unusual ability to communicate with the public, Village officials and other employees and departments in routine and stressful situations. 
Physical ability to perform successfully in the position. 
(Ord. No. 3796-2006, § 1, 2-6-06) 
Sec. 5-6-3. - Duties and responsibilities. 
    The Fire Chief shall have control and management of all matters and things pertaining to the Fire Department, and all officers and employees. 
    The Fire Chief shall prepare and submit to the Village Manager an estimate of the total cost and expense of providing for and maintaining the Fire Department of the Village during the ensuing fiscal year, which estimates shall be submitted in the form and time required by the Village Manager. 
    On or before December 31 of each year, the Fire Chief shall prepare and submit to the Village Manager an annual report which will include a listing of all incidents by fire that may have taken place in the Village during the preceding fiscal year, the cause of same, a description of all buildings destroyed, as well as a report as to persons injured or killed. 
    The Fire Chief shall inquire into, investigate causes of all fires in the Village, as soon after their occurrence as practical, and he shall keep a record of such investigations and evidence adduced thereby. 
    The Fire Chief shall keep a full and complete record of all transactions of the Department, of all property in his charge, as well as such records as shall be required to conduct the business of the Department. 
    The Fire Chief, or his designate, shall examine all fire engines, apparatus and fire hose, as well as other life safety/support equipment from time to time to ensure such engines, apparatus, fire hose and other life safety/support equipment are in good operating condition. 
    The Fire Chief shall arrange the working hours of the members of the Department. However, the Fire Chief, acting in his official capacity, may in case of serious conflagration, riot or other dire emergency, require such members of the Department to be on duty or to continue on duty during the period of such emergency. 
    It shall be the duty of the Fire Chief to file a report to the Village Manager when any member of the Fire Department shall have performed any distinguished actions of bravery in the performance of duty. The Village Manager shall forward such report to the President and Board of Trustees for such acts of commendation as the President and Board of Trustees may seek to bestow upon such member or members of the Fire Department. 
    It shall be the duty of the Fire Chief to cause a record to be kept, to be known as the "Merit Roll", upon which shall be entered the names of all members of the Fire Department who shall have performed any distinguished actions of bravery in the performance of duty. Such record shall specify the details and circumstances of such actions, and there shall also be given names of witnesses, if any, and all facts corroborating the circumstances of the report. 
    The Fire Chief shall establish and maintain a system for annual performance evaluations of each employee of the Fire Department. For employees that come under the Fire and Police Commission's rules and regulations, a performance evaluation shall be submitted to the Board of Fire and Police Commissioners prior to an employee being taken off probation or as part of a promotional process. 
    The President and Board of Trustees shall have the authority to approve and disapprove any major changes in the Hoffman Estates Fire Department including, but not limited to, the manner the Department provides fire protection, paramedic services, fire prevention, and manning of fire stations. The Fire Chief will submit proposed changes to the President and Board of Trustees and will comply with the advice and consent of the President and Board of Trustees. 
(Ord. No. 3796-2006, § 1, 2-6-06) 
Sec. 5-6-4. - Rules and regulations. 
    The Fire Chief may make or describe such rules and regulations for the guidance of the members of the Department as he shall see fit, and such rules and regulations shall be binding on such members. 
(Ord. No. 3796-2006, § 1, 2-6-06) 
Sec. 5-6-5. - Removal of property. 
    The Fire Chief shall have the power to cause the removal of any property, whenever it shall become necessary for the preservation of such property from fire or to prevent the spreading of fire or to protect adjoining property. 
(Ord. No. 3796-2006, § 1, 2-6-06) 
Sec. 5-6-6. - Destruction of buildings. 
    The Fire Chief or other officer in command, may direct the firefighters to cut down and remove any building, erection or fence, for the purpose of checking the progress of any fire; and the Fire Chief, or other officer in command, shall have power to blow up or cause to be blown up, with an explosive, any building or erection during the progress of a fire for the purpose of extinguishing or checking same. 
(Ord. No. 3796-2006, § 1, 2-6-06) 
Sec. 5-6-7. - Power of arrest. 
    No member of the Fire Department shall have the power to arrest unless classified as a fire investigator under the requirements of 20 ILCS 2910/1. 
(Ord. No. 3796-2006, § 1, 2-6-06) 
Sec. 5-6-8. - Exempt rank. 
A.  The Village Manager shall be and he is hereby authorized to appoint upon the recommendation of the Fire Chief, two Deputy Fire Chiefs, one Assistant Fire Chief, and three Battalion Chiefs, who shall serve at the pleasure of the Village Manager. Such appointment shall be on probation for 12 months. 
B.  The Fire Chief is hereby authorized to discipline or suspend up to ten days subject to the provision of the Hoffman Estates Personnel Policy Manual. The Village Manager, upon the recommendation of the Fire Chief, may discharge subject to the provisions of the Hoffman Estates Personnel Policy Manual any or all of the persons holding the positions of Deputy Fire Chief, Assistant Fire Chief, or Battalion Chief who hold no permanent rank in the Fire Department as established under the Illinois Board of Fire and Police Commissioners Act or Section 4-6 of the Hoffman Estates Municipal Code. 
C.  The Fire Chief is also hereby authorized to discipline or suspend up to ten days subject to the provisions of the Hoffman Estates Personnel Policy Manual any or all persons holding the position of Deputy Fire Chief, Assistant Fire Chief or Battalion Chief who hold permanent rank in the Fire Department as established under the Illinois Board of Fire and Police Commissioners Act or Section 4-6 of the Hoffman Estates Municipal Code. The Fire Chief may file charges for discharge before the Hoffman Estates Fire and Police Commission against any or all persons holding the position of Deputy Fire Chief, Assistant Fire Chief, or Battalion Chief who hold permanent rank in the Fire Department as established under the Illinois Board of Fire and Police Commissioners Act or Section 4-6 of the Hoffman Estates Municipal Code. 
(Ord. No. 3796-2006, § 1, 2-6-06) 
Sec. 5-6-9. - Personnel. 
A.  The Fire Department shall consist of the following full-time sworn personnel; one (1) Fire Chief; one (1) Deputy Fire Chief; one (1) Assistant Fire Chief; three (3) Battalion Chiefs; four (4) Captains; eleven (11) Lieutenants; and seventy-five (75) Firefighters. 
B.  The Village Manager shall have the authority to increase the number of full-time sworn firefighters upon a finding that one or more of the full-time sworn firefighters is inactive under the Public Employee Disability Act and is not likely to return to active service or is inactive pending an announced retirement date. Such increase shall be limited in duration to the time the full-time sworn firefighter is or the full-time sworn firefighters are inactive under the Public Employee Disability Act or pending an announced retirement date. 
C.  The Fire Chief shall have the authority to determine service levels on a day-to-day basis. 
(Ord. No. 4453-2014, § 1, 11-3-14)
