It shall be unlawful to present a concert as herein defined before an anticipated gathering of more than 300 persons without having applied for a license therefore as herein provided. Said license shall be issued upon completed application subject to Section 8-1-14. This requirement shall not apply to facilities owned by the Village and/or any Village sponsored event. 
B.  Definition. "Concert" shall mean a musical performance by voice or several voices, or by any type or types of musical instruments, or both generally open to the public. 
C.  Application. Applications for such license shall be made in conformance with the general provisions relating to such application but shall additionally include the following information: 
1.  A listing of the titles of principal attractions and the names and addresses of the principal performer or principal performers scheduled to appear in the performance for which the permit is sought. If any changes are made in the scheduled principal performances or principal performers, an amended application must be made with respect to these changes, but only with respect to the changes. 
2.  Information concerning the time and the approximate duration of the scheduled performance. 
3.  The number of anticipated spectators for the performance. If the number of anticipated spectators is expected to vary for the performances this variance must also be listed. 
4.  A statement concerning the proposed method for handling admissions and ticket sales in such a manner to ensure that sufficient means will be available for refusal of entry or refunding should that become necessary. 
5.  The past history, if any, for the past two years of the principal performers at any proposed concert with respect to any material disturbances associated with their performances stating the source of information, frequency of the disturbances and the amount of individual and property damage. 
6.  Applications shall be made 30 days prior to a scheduled performance whenever practicable. Any application submitted less than 30 days prior to a scheduled performance shall be accompanied by an affidavit stating reasons for late submission. 
D.  Regulations and Investigation. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Police Department. The Village Manager and Police Department shall receive copies of applications for purposes of investigation. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-4-12. - Lotteries. 
A.  License Required. It shall be unlawful to conduct a lottery as defined by 720 ILCS 5/28-1 without having obtained a license therefor. 
B.  Application. 
1.  The license and application for license must specify the area or areas within the licensing authority in which raffle chances will be sold or issued, the time of determination of winning chances and the location or locations at which winning chances will be determined. 
2.  The application must contain a sworn statement attesting to the not-for-profit character of the prospective licensee organization, signed by the presiding officer and the secretary of that organization. No bond shall be required for such application and license. 
C.  Conduct of Raffles. The conducting of raffles is subject to the following restrictions: 
1.  The entire net proceeds of any raffle must be exclusively devoted to the lawful purposes of the organization permitted to conduct the game. 
2.  No person except a bona fide member of the sponsoring organization may participate in the management or operation of the raffle. 
3.  No person may receive any remuneration or profit for participating in the management or operation of the raffle. 
4.  A licensee may rent a premises on which to determine the winning chance or chances in a raffle only from an organization which is also licensed under this section. 
5.  Raffle chances may be sold or issued only within the area specified on the license and winning chances may be determined only at those locations specified on the license. 
6.  No person under the age of 18 years may participate in the conducting of raffles or chances. A person under the age of 18 years may be within the area where winning chances are being determined only when accompanied by his parent or guardian. 
D.  Records. Records shall be kept pursuant to the provisions of 230 ILCS 15/6. 
E.  Requirements. Only non-profit organizations as defined by 230 ILCS 15/2 may apply for a license. There shall be no limit on aggregate retail value of prizes, number of tickets, price of tickets or time period of the raffle. 
    The following are ineligible for any license under this section: 
1.  Any person who has been convicted of a felony; 
2.  Any person who is or has been a professional gambler or gambling promoter; 
3.  Any person who is not of good moral character; 
4.  Any firm or corporation in which a person defined in 1, 2 or 3 has a proprietary, equitable or credit interest, or in which such a person is active or employed; 
5.  Any organization in which a person defined in 1, 2 or 3 is an office, director, or employee, whether compensated or not; 
6.  Any organization in which a person defined is 1, 2 or 3 is to participate in the management or operation of a raffle as defined in this section. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-4-13. - Special events. 
A.  Permit Required. It shall be unlawful for any person to conduct a special event in or upon any public street, sidewalk or alley in the Village or knowingly participate in any such special event unless and until a permit to conduct such special event has been obtained from the Police Department. 
B.  Definitions. 
1.  Special Event. Special event means any march or procession consisting of people, animals or vehicles, or combination thereof, upon any public street or sidewalk which does not comply with normal and usual traffic regulations or controls. 
C.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Hoffman Estates Special Events Administrative Procedures. 
D.  Fees. Fees associated with Village-related expenses shall be the responsibility of the special event sponsor. 
E.  Waiver of Fees. Special event fees may be waived when authorized by the Village Board. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-4-14. - Dart rooms. 
A.  License Required. No person, firm or corporation shall operate or maintain a dart room open to the public without having first obtained a license therefor as in herein provided. Applications for such licenses shall be made in writing to the Village Clerk and shall state thereon the intended location of the place of business and the number of alleys to be used. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-4-15. - Video gaming terminal. 
A.  Definition . As defined in 230 ILCS 40/5, "any electronic video game machine that, upon insertion of cash, is available to play or simulate the play of a video game, including but not limited to video poker, line up, and blackjack, as authorized by the Board utilizing a video display and microprocessors in which the player may receive free games or credits that can be redeemed for cash. The term does not include a machine that directly dispenses coins, cash, or tokens or is for amusement purposes only." 
B.  License Required . No person, firm or corporation shall offer for play any Video Gaming Terminal in the Village of Hoffman Estates without having first obtained from the Village of Hoffman Estates the proper license for each Video Gaming Terminal. Applications for such Video Gaming Terminal licenses shall be made in writing to the Village Clerk and shall state thereon the location of the place of business and the total number of Video Gaming Terminals intended to be used, and further provide a copy of any current license or licenses issued to Applicant by the State of Illinois under the Video Gaming Act, 230 ILCS 40 (2009). 
C.  Revocation. Any Video Gaming Terminal license may be revoked by the President at any time during the life of such license for any violation of any of the provisions of this Municipal Code, or any applicable laws, rules or regulations of the State of Illinois relating to the Video Gaming Act, 230 ILCS 40 (2009) and such revocation may be in addition to any fine imposed. 
(Ord. No. 4318-2012, § 3, 7-23-12) 
Sec. 8-4-16. - Terminal operator. 
A.  Definition. As defined in 230 ILCS 40/5 (2009), "an individual, partnership, corporation, or limited liability company that is licensed under this Act and that owns, services, and maintains video gaming terminals for placement in licensed establishments, licensed truck stop establishments, licensed fraternal establishments, or licensed veterans establishments." 
B.  License Required. No person, firm or corporation shall own, service and/or maintain any Video Gaming Terminal in the Village of Hoffman Estates without having first obtained from the Village of Hoffman Estates the proper license for each Terminal Operator. Applications for such Terminal Operator licenses shall be made in writing to the Village Clerk and Applicant shall further provide a copy of any current license or licenses issued to Applicant by the State of Illinois under the Video Gaming Act, 230 ILCS 40 (2009). 
C.  Revocation. Any Terminal Operator's license may be revoked by the President at any time during the life of such license for any violation of any of the provisions of this Municipal Code, or any applicable laws, rules or regulations of the State of Illinois relating to the Video Gaming Act, 230 ILCS 40 (2009), and such revocation may be in addition to any fine imposed. 
(Ord. No. 4318-2012, § 4, 7-23-12) 
ARTICLE 5. - FOODS AND BEVERAGES 

Sec. 8-5-1. - Automatic food vending machine. 
A.  Definition. "Automatic Food Vending Machine" shall mean any mechanical container or device used for the sale of any beverage or article of food, the operation of which is governed or controlled by the deposit of a coin or token. 
B.  License Required. No person, firm or corporation wherein a food vending machine is placed shall install, keep, use, maintain or operate such machine without obtaining the proper license for each such food vending machine. 
C.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Code Enforcement including inspection before issuance of license. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-5-2. - Bakeries. 
A.  Definition. "Bakery" shall mean any place or establishment used for any process of mixing, compounding or making, for sale, bread, biscuits, pretzels, crackers, buns, rolls, macaroni, cake, pies or any food product of which flour or meal is the principal ingredient, shall be deemed a bakery for the purpose of this Article, provided that restaurants in which any of the foregoing food products are mixed and baked, on or in ordinary kitchen stove or range, shall not be considered to be bakeries. 
B.  License Required. It shall be unlawful to conduct or operate a bakery in the Village without having obtained a license therefor. 
C.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Code Enforcement including inspection before issuance of license. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-5-3. - Cafeterias. 
A.  Definition. "Cafeteria" shall mean any fixed, non-mobile private or non-profit institution in which food or drink is prepared for sale or service in which persons serve themselves or are served at a counter and take the food to tables to eat. 
B.  License Required. It shall be unlawful to engage in the business of a cafeteria without obtaining a license therefor. 
C.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Code Enforcement, including inspection before issuance of license. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-5-4. - Drive-in/carry-out restaurants. 
A.  License Required. It shall be unlawful to engage in the business of Drive-In/Carry-Out Restaurant without obtaining a license therefore. 
B.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Code Enforcement including inspection before issuance of license. 
(Ord. No. 4466-2015, § 6, 3-23-15) 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 4466-2015, § 6, adopted March 23, 2015, amended § 8-5-4 in its entirety to read as herein set out. Former § 8-5-4 pertained to drive-in restaurant, and derived from Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), adopted May 2, 2011. 
Sec. 8-5-5. - Food dealers. 
A.  Definition. "Food Dealer" shall mean every person, firm or corporation engaged in conducting or operating any or all of the following businesses: fruit store or establishment for the retail sale of fresh fruits and berries; grocery store, or establishment for the sale of butter, cheese, vegetables, or other provisions; ice cream parlor; meat market or establishment for the retail sale of fresh meats, poultry or fish; retail beverage store, or establishment for the sale at retail of any malted, cereal, carbonated or vinous non-intoxicating beverages as defined by law; confectionery store, or establishment for the sale of candy and not for human consumption on the premises. 
B.  License Required. It shall be unlawful for any food dealer to engage in or do business in the Village without having secured a license therefor. 
C.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Code Enforcement including inspection before issuance of license. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-5-6. - Food deliveries. 
A.  License Required. It shall be unlawful to use or permit the use of any vehicle, including wagons and vehicles propelled by human power, for the storage or carrying of any meat, poultry, fish, butter, cheese, lard, vegetables, bread or bakery products, or any other provisions of food intended for human consumption, including milk, in the Village for the purpose of delivering any such food to any place in the Village for the use and consumption or for resale in the Village for such purposes, unless a license for such vehicle is first secured and provisions of the Article are fully complied with. 
B.  Exemptions. No license fee shall be required for any vehicle used to deliver foodstuffs from any establishment which is licensed and inspected as a food dealer or food service establishment in the Village; but all provisions of this Code, other than providing for the payment of a fee, shall be complied with in connection with such vehicle. 
C.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Code Enforcement, including inspection before issuance of license. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11; Ord. No. 4442-2014, § 7, 7-21-14) 
Sec. 8-5-7. - Food service establishments. 
A.  Definitions. 
1.  Permanent Food Service Establishment shall mean any fixed, non-mobile restaurant; coffee shop; short-order cafe; luncheonette; grill; tearoom; sandwich shop; soda fountain; cocktail lounge; night club; industrial feeding establishment; private, public or non-profit organization or institution routinely serving food; catering kitchen; commissary or similar places in which food or drink is prepared for sale or for service on the premises or elsewhere; and any other eating or drinking establishment or operation where food is served or provided for the public with or without charge. 
2.  Banquet Food Service Establishment shall mean any fixed, non-mobile facility in which food or drink is prepared for service on the premises where food is served or provided to primarily private groups. 
3.  Temporary Food Service Establishment shall mean any food service establishment which operates at a fixed location for a temporary period of time, not to exceed two weeks each year, in connection with a fair, carnival, circus, public exhibition, or similar transitory gathering. 
4.  Outdoor Food Service Establishment shall mean any food service establishment which operates outdoors on Village-owned property and subject to a separate agreement with the Village. 
B.  License Required. It shall be unlawful to engage in the business of a Food Service Establishment, either permanent, banquet, mobile, temporary, restaurant caterer or outdoor food service without obtaining a license therefor. 
C.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Code Enforcement including inspection before issuance of license. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11; Ord. No. 4442-2014, § 8, 7-21-14; Ord. No. 4466-2015, § 7, 3-23-15) 
Sec. 8-5-8. - Ice cream manufacturers. 
A.  License Required. It shall be unlawful to engage in the business of the manufacture for wholesale or retail distribution of ice cream, candy or other confections in the Village, other than bakery goods, without obtaining a license therefore as is herein provided. Applications for such license shall be made to the Village Clerk. 
B.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Code Enforcement including inspection before issuance of license. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-5-9. - Milk. 
A.  Definition. "Milk" shall mean the whole, fresh, clean lacteal secretion obtained from the milking of one or more cows. Unless the context otherwise indicates, the term "milk" when used herein shall include whole milk, skimmed milk, sour milk, cream, sour cream, buttermilk, cultured buttermilk and milk beverages. 
B.  License Required. It shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to operate a store known as a milk store or a vehicle or vehicles for the delivery of milk without obtaining a license to do so. 
C.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Code Enforcement, 410 ILCS 635/1 et seq. including inspection before issuance of license. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-5-10. - Retail food stores. 
A.  Definition. "Retail Food Store" shall mean every person, firm or corporation engaged in conducting or operating any or all of the following businesses: fruit store or retail sale of fresh fruits or berries; general grocery items; retail sale of butter, cheese, vegetables, or other provisions; ice cream; meat market or retail sale of fresh meat; poultry or fish; frozen food; beverages of all kinds; retail sale of any malted, cereal, carbonated or vinous non-intoxicating beverages, as defined by law; confectionery; or retail sale of candy for human consumption on premises. 
B.  License. It shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to engage in or do business as a retail food store in the Village without having secured a license therefor. A licensee hereunder shall not be required to obtain a separate license for those items listed in Subsection A hereof; provided, however, that if alcoholic beverages are sold on the premises, a separate license, according to Article 3 of this Chapter shall be required. 
C.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Code Enforcement, including inspection before issuance of license. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-5-11. - Mobile food service. 
A.  Definition. "Mobile food service" shall mean any motorized vehicle in which food or non-alcoholic drink is prepared, or stored, for sale or service to the public from the vehicle anywhere on publicly owned parking lots or privately owned property, subject to the approval of the property owner. 
B.  License. It shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to engage in or do business as a mobile food service in the Village without having secured a mobile food service license for each vehicle. 
C.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Village including sales tax requirements and the passing of an inspection by the Village Environmental Health Officer, for each mobile food service licensed vehicle prior to issuance of the license. Sales shall not occur on any public right-of-way. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-5-12. - Food manufacturer and distributor (wholesale). 
A.  Definitions. 
1.  "Food Manufacturer and Distributor (Wholesale)" shall mean any Person engaged in the business of manufacturing food products within the Village of Hoffman Estates for distribution at wholesale. 
2.  "Wholesale" as used herein shall mean the transfer of the ownership or title to tangible personal property in the form of manufactured food products to another for purposes of resale, other than to a consumer or end user which transfer is not subject to a retail sales tax. 
3.  "Person" means any individual, partnership, limited liability company, corporation or other legal entity. 
B.  License required. It shall be unlawful for any Person to conduct business as a Food Manufacturer and Distributor (Wholesale) in the Village of Hoffman Estates without having first obtained a license therefor. 
C.  Application. An application for a Food Manufacturer and Distributor (Wholesale) license shall be made in conformity with the general requirements of this Chapter relating to applications for licenses. 
D.  Exemptions. No other or further business license as Food Deliveries (Section 8-5-6) shall be required nor fee paid where a Food Manufacturer and Distributor (Wholesale) license is secured. 
E.  Regulations. Each Food Manufacturer and Distributor (Wholesale) shall comply with this Sec. 8-5-12 and with all applicable State laws and this Municipal Code, and the Village's Code Enforcement and the Fire and Police Departments, including the right of inspection before issuance of license. 
(Ord. No. 4507-2015, § 2, 9-21-15) 
ARTICLE 6. - HEALTH AND CARE FACILITIES 

Sec. 8-6-1. - Hospital. 
A.  Definition. "Hospital" shall mean any institution or place used for the harboring or the reception, care and treatment, including treatments known as rest cure, physical culture, hydropathic massage, and all other forms of drugless treatment, of two or more persons suffering from or afflicted with any mental or physical disease, bodily injury, alcohol or drug addiction; or any institution or place for the reception and care, temporary or continuous, of one or more women during pregnancy while awaiting confinement, during confinement, or for one month or less after confinement, while recovering therefrom; or any place or establishment advertised, announced, conducted, or maintained under the name "hospital" without a qualifying statement that such hospital is not intended for human beings. 
B.  License Required. It shall be unlawful for any person other than the regularly constituted authorities of the United States, the State, the County, or the Village to conduct or operate any hospital within the Village without obtaining a license therefor. 
C.  Exemptions. Hospitals which are operated without a charge being made for the care of patients shall be exempt from the payment of a license fee. Operators of such hospitals shall be required to make application for said license which shall be accompanied by an affidavit stating that no charge is made for the care of patients. Such exemption shall continue only for the duration of the license period. 
D.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Health & Human Services, Code Enforcement, Police Department, and such other regulations of the Village that are applicable. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-6-2. - Skilled nursing facility. 
A.  Definition. "Skilled Nursing Facility" shall mean skilled nursing care, continuous skilled nursing observations, restorative nursing, and other services under professional direction with frequent medical supervision. Such facilities are provided for patients who need the type of care and treatment required during the post-acute phase of illness or during recurrences of symptoms in long-term illness. 
B.  License Required. It shall be unlawful for any person other than the regularly constituted authorities of the United States, the State, the County or the Village to conduct or operate any skilled nursing facility within the Village without obtaining a license therefor. 
C.  Exemptions. Skilled Nursing Facilities which are operated without a charge being made for the care of patients shall be exempt from the payment of a license fee. Operators of such skilled nursing facilities shall be required to make application for said license which shall be accompanied by an affidavit stating that no charge is made for the care of patients. Such exemption shall continue only for the duration of the license period. 
D.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Health & Human Services, Code Enforcement, Police Department, and such other regulations of the Village that are applicable. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-6-3. - Nursing home. 
A.  Definition. "Nursing Home" shall mean any institution, place, building or agency which maintains and operates 24-hour nursing services for the care and treatment of chronically ill or convalescent patients, including mental, emotional or behavioral problems, mental retardation or alcoholism. 
B.  License Required. It shall be unlawful for any person other than the regularly constituted authorities of the United States, the State, the County, or the Village to conduct or operate any nursing home within the Village without obtaining a license therefor. 
C.  Exemptions. Nursing homes which are operated without a charge being made for the care of patients shall be exempt from the payment of a license fee. Operators of such nursing homes shall be required to make application for said license which shall be accompanied by an affidavit stating that no charge is made for the care of patients. Such exemption shall continue only for the duration of the license period. 
D.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Health & Human Services, Code Enforcement, Police Department, and such other regulations of the Village that are applicable. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-6-4. - Intermediate care facility. 
A.  Definition. "Intermediate Care Facility" shall mean basic nursing care and other restorative services under periodic medical direction. Many of these services may require skill in administration. Such facilities are for patients who have long-term illnesses or disabilities which may have reached a relatively stable plateau. 
B.  License Required. It shall be unlawful for any person other than the regularly constituted authorities of the United States, the State, the Count[y], or the Village to conduct or operate any intermediate care facility within the Village without obtaining a license therefor. 
C.  Exemptions. Intermediate Care Facilities which are operated without a charge being made for the care of patients shall be exempt from the payment of a license fee. Operators of such intermediate care facilities shall be required to make application for said license which shall be accompanied by an affidavit stating that no charge is made for the care of patients. Such exemption shall continue only for the duration of the license period. 
D.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Health & Human Services, Code Enforcement, Police Department, and such other regulations of the Village that are applicable. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-6-5. - Sheltered care facility. 
A.  Definition. "Sheltered Care Facility" shall mean personal care and assistance, supervision oversight, and a suitable activities program and shall be defined and interpreted in a consistent manner with the definitions and provisions of 210 ILCS 45 et seq., the Nursing Home Care Act. Provisions are made for medical care as necessary. Such facilities are for individuals who do not need nursing care, but do need personal care, assistance, supervision, and/or oversight in meeting their daily personal needs. 
B.  License Required. It shall be unlawful for any person other than the regularly constituted authorities of the United States, the State, the County, or the Village to conduct or operate any sheltered care facility within the Village without obtaining a license therefor. 
C.  License Application Submittal. If the facility will primarily serve older adults, the following requirements shall apply. In addition to completion of an application form required by Section 8-1-3, any application for a license shall include the following written documentation: 
 procedures for continued stay criteria regularly applied (quarterly or more often as necessary) which evaluate, determine program needs, and transition residents through the various levels of service provided at the facility. This includes assessing the ability of residents to participate in the informed decision making process regarding their services. 
 procedures to insure that all personnel with resident contact receive ongoing training in relevant gerontology topics. 
 comprehensive disposition procedures which demonstrate a thorough presentation of options and matching of needs with services. 
D.  Review of Application. The Village Clerk shall refer copies of such application documentation to the Health and Human Services Department, Fire Department, Police Department and Department of Development Services. The appropriate departments shall make an investigation of the application and make written recommendation to the Village Clerk concerning compliance with Village Codes and state law within 25 days of the application submittal and the Village Clerk shall approve or give reasons for disapproval of the license application submittal to the applicant within 30 days of the application submittal. 
E.  Exemptions. Sheltered Care Facilities which are operated without a charge being made for the care of patients shall be exempt from the payment of the license fee. Operators of such sheltered care facilities shall be required to make application for said license which shall be accompanied by an affidavit stating that no charge is made for the care of patients. Such exemption shall continue only for the duration of the license period. 
F.  Inspections. All sheltered care facilities, their operating procedures, and their case management records, within the guidelines of confidentiality, shall be subject to inspection by the Village as necessary to ensure compliance with these and other applicable standards as provided in Sheltered Care Code 330.240e. 
G.  Serious Incident. Within three days of such incident, the operator of the facility shall notify the Village Director of Health & Human Services, in writing, of any serious incidents or accidents (as defined by Section 330.780 of the State of Illinois Sheltered Care Facilities Administrative Code) which occur at the facility. 
H.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Health & Human Services, Community Development Department, Fire Department and such other regulations of the Village that are applicable. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-6-6. - Congregate care facility. 
A.  Definition. "Congregate Care Facility" shall mean a facility in which care or supportive services are received by six or more residents. Services may include, but are not limited to, the following: meals, housekeeping, laundry, social, recreational, education programs, protective security, transportation, or response to medical emergencies. Such facilities may also be known by other names, including but not limited to, Assisted Living, Life Care Facilities, Planned Living Community. 
B.  License Required. It shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to maintain or conduct a congregate care facility within the Village of Hoffman Estates without obtaining a license therefore. 
C.  Any application for a license may be denied for any of the following reasons: 
1.  Failure to meet the minimum standards prescribed whether by the Village or another regulatory body. 
2.  Conviction of the applicant, if the applicant is a firm, partnership or association, of any of its members; or if a corporation, or any of its officers or directors; or of the person designated to manager or supervise the facility, of a felony or of two or more misdemeanors involving moral turpitude, or, in the case of the conviction of a misdemeanor by a court not of record, as shown by other evidence; or other satisfactory evidence that the moral character of the applicant or manager or supervisor of the home is not reputable. 
3.  Personnel insufficient in number or unqualified by training or experience to properly care for the proposed number and type of residents. 
4.  Insufficient financial or other resources to operate and conduct the home in accordance with the requirements of the minimum standards or rules and regulations promulgated thereunder. A license may be revoked or renewal denied for any of the following reasons: 
a.  Cruelty or indifference to the welfare of a resident. 
b.  Misappropriation of the property of a resident. 
c.  Conversion of the property to a resident. 
d.  Any ground upon which an application for a license may be denied. 
D.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Health and Human Services, Department of Code Enforcement, Fire Department, Police Department and such other regulations of the Village that are applicable. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-6-7. - Veterinary hospitals. 
A.  Definition. "Veterinary Hospital" shall mean any institution, place, or enclosure used for the harboring or reception for care or treatment of two or more horses, dogs, cats, or other animals. 
B.  License Required. An application for a veterinary hospital license shall be made in conformity with the general requirements of this Code relating to applications for licenses. 
C.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Code Enforcement. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-6-8. - Ambulance service. 
A.  License Required. 
1.  Ambulance Service. No person, either as owner, agent or otherwise shall furnish, operate, conduct, maintain, advertise, or otherwise be engaged in or profess to be engaged in the business or service of operating an ambulance upon the streets, alleys or public ways of the Village unless the owner of the ambulance is currently and validly licensed as an Ambulance Service pursuant to this Article. An ambulance operated by an agency of the State of Illinois or the United States shall not be required to be licensed hereunder. No license shall be required for an ambulance which is rendering assistance in the case of a major catastrophe or emergency with which the Ambulance Services and M.I.C.U. Services licensed by the Village are insufficient or unable to cope, or is operated from a location of headquarters outside of the Village in order to transport patients who are picked up beyond the limits of the Village to locations within the Village; however, no such outside ambulance shall be used to pick up patients within the Village except under a mutual aid agreement. 
2.  Mobile Intensive Care Unit Service. No person, either as owner, agent or otherwise, shall furnish, operate, conduct, maintain, advertise or otherwise be engaged in or profess to be engaged in the business or service of operating an M.I.C.U. upon the streets or public ways of the Village unless the owner of the M.I.C.U. is currently, validly licensed as a Mobile Intensive Care Unit Service pursuant to this Article. An M.I.C.U. operated by an agency of the State of Illinois or the United States shall not be required to be licensed hereunder. 
B.  Inspections. All ambulances or M.I.C.U.'s operated by a licensee shall be in compliance with the statutes of the State of Illinois. The Village shall retain the right of additional inspection under the standards of the statutes of the State of Illinois. 
C.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all regulations of the State of Illinois Department of Public Health and such other regulations of the Village that are applicable. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-6-9. - Day care centers. 
A.  License Required. It shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to conduct a day care center within the Village of Hoffman Estates without obtaining a license therefor. 
B.  Definition. "Day Care Center" means any person, group of persons or corporation whether established for gain or otherwise, which receives or arranges for care of placement of children, unrelated to the operator of the facility, which regularly provides day care for less than 24 hours per day. 
C.  Exclusions. "Day Care Center" shall not include: 
1.  Programs operated by a public or private accredited school system. 
2.  Programs operated on federal government premises. 
3.  Programs conducted by civic, charitable or government organizations on an organized basis for athletics, music, crafts or other similar activities. 
4.  A day care center conducted in a person's home where children of no more than one family are cared for. 
D.  Standards. Insofar as applicable to the operation of each facility, all facilities shall meet the minimum standards prescribed by the Illinois Department of Children and Family Services for such facilities as well as complying with all applicable regulations of the Village. 
E.  Disqualification. No license shall be issued to operate any facility where the requirements of Subsection D cannot be met or where the criminal history record check of persons named in the application reveals a conviction record for any offense bearing a reasonable or rational relation to the operation and performance of a day care center. 
F.  Duties. It shall be the responsibility of each and every license holder under this section to: 
1.  Submit within ten days of application the names of any applicant for employment, volunteer manager or owner, who has not previously been submitted for a criminal history record check at the time of application or renewal. 
2.  Inform the Hoffman Estates Police Department within three days of the name of any owner, manager, employee or volunteer who has been arrested for any offense bearing a reasonable or rational relation to the operation and performance of a day care center. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-6-10. - Mobile health facility. 
A.  Definition. "Mobile Health Facility" shall mean any separate facility of mobile construction whether operated by an otherwise licensed hospital or nursing or care facility or not that is used for the harboring or the reception, care, testing or treatment of persons tested for or suffering from or afflicted with any mental or physical disease, bodily injury, alcohol or drug addiction. 
B.  License Required. It shall be unlawful for any person other than the regularly constituted authorities of the United States, the State, the County or the Village to conduct or operate any mobile health facility within the Village without obtaining a license therefor. 
C.  Exemptions. Mobile Health Facilities which are operated without a charge being made for the care of patients shall be exempt from the payment of a license fee. Operators of such mobile health facilities shall be required to make application for said license which shall be accompanied by an affidavit stating that no charge is made for the reception, care, testing or treatment of patients. Such exemption shall continue only for the duration of the license period. 
D.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Health & Human Services, Code Enforcement, Police Department and such other regulations of the Village that are applicable. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-6-11. - Children's hospitals. 
A.  Definition. Children's hospital shall mean a hospital devoted exclusively to caring for children or any facility within a hospital devoted exclusively to caring for children. A Hospital shall mean a health-care facility as defined in section 3(A) of the Illinois Hospital Licensing Act (210 ILCS 85/3). 
B.  License Required. It shall be unlawful for any person, group of persons or corporations other than the regularly constituted facilities of the United States, the State, the County, or the Village to conduct or operate any children's hospital within the Village without obtaining a license therefore. 
C.  Regulations. Any children's hospital licensed pursuant to this Ordinance shall substantially comply with all applicable standards and regulations of the Illinois Department of Public Health, as provided in the Hospital Licensing Act and the Illinois Department of Healthcare and Family Services, as provided in 305 ILCS 5/5-5.02, including Title 89, Ch. 1, Sec. 148.120 and Sec. 148.295 of the Illinois Administrative Code. 
D.  License Fee. The fee for issuance or renewal of a children's hospital license shall be $500.00. 
E.  Application for a License. Application for issuance or renewal of a Village children's hospital license shall be made to the Village in similar manner as provided for in the Illinois Hospital Licensing Act for issuance and renewal of a hospital license by the Illinois Department of Public Health, and shall specifically identify any facility within a hospital devoted exclusively to caring for children for which a license is sought pursuant to this section. The applicant shall also comply with all applicable regulations of the Village Department of Health & Human Services, Code Enforcement, Police Department, and such other ordinances and regulations of the Village that are applicable. 
F.  Denial, Suspension or Revocation of License. Denial, suspension or revocation of a hospital license by the State of Illinois shall be grounds for denial, supervision or revocation of a children's hospital license by the Village. The children's hospital shall immediately report to the Village any notice by the State of Illinois of substantial failure to comply with applicable standards, rules or regulations. 
(Ord. No. 4356-2013, § 1, 2-25-13) 
ARTICLE 7. - MERCHANTS (PRODUCTS) 

Sec. 8-7-1. - Auctioneers. 
A.  License Required. It shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to conduct an auction in the Village of Hoffman Estates or to do business as an auctioneer without having obtained a license therefor. 
B.  Auction in Streets. No person shall sell or attempt to sell or offer for sale at public auction, any goods, chattels, or personal or real property of any kind upon the public streets or sidewalks of the Village. 
C.  Exemptions. Nothing in this Article shall apply to any public auction or sale made or conducted by a public officer by virtue of any authority contained in a mortgage or trust deed, or where a Wholesale Vehicle Auction House license is issued in accordance with Section 8-11-6 of this Code. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11; Ord. No. 4470-2015, § 2, 4-6-15) 
Sec. 8-7-2. - Automobile accessories. 
A.  License Required. It shall be unlawful to conduct or operate a business for the sale of automobile accessories without having obtained a license therefor. Application for such license shall be made in writing to the Village Clerk. 
B.  Regulations. Outdoor display of merchandise and the use of pennants and advertising banners are prohibited. 
C.  Building and Fire Regulations. The construction, equipment and storage or materials shall be made and maintained in accordance with the provisions of the Fire Protection Code recommended by the National Board of Fire Underwriters. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-7-3. - Automobile sales lot. 
A.  Definition. "Automobile Sales Lot" shall mean any premises, enclosure, or other place within the Village where business of dealing in new or second hand motor vehicles, is conducted or operated. 
B.  License Required. It shall be unlawful for any automobile dealer to engage in or do business in the Village without having secured a license therefor, but nothing contained in this Article shall apply to a Wholesale Vehicle Auction House duly licensed in accordance with Section 8-11-6 of this Code. 
C.  Location and Frontage Consents. No person shall construct, conduct or operate any automobile or motor vehicle sales lot or used car lot within 200 feet of any building used as a hospital, church, or public or parochial school, or the grounds thereof. No person shall construct, conduct or operate any automobile or motor vehicle sales lot or used car lot on any lot in any block in which 2/3 of the buildings on both sides of the street are used exclusively for residence purposes or within 200 feet of any such street, in any such block, without the written consent of a majority of the property owners, according to the frontage of both sides of the street and for a distance of 200 feet from the lot to be used for said purposes, provided that all lots which abut only on a public alley or court shall be considered as fronting on the street to which such alley or court leads. 
Such written consents shall be obtained and filed with the Department of Code Enforcement before a permit is issued for the construction or erection of any signs, sign posts, fences, barricades, or buildings, or before the Village Clerk shall issue a permit for the construction or use of a driveway across any sidewalk or parkway in the Village. In determining whether 2/3 of the buildings on both sides of such street are used exclusively for residence purposes and for the purpose of determining frontage consents, any building fronting upon any street and located upon a corner lot, shall not be considered. 
D.  Application. Provision of this Code shall apply only where the premises are of such a nature that motor vehicles are or may be admitted thereto. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11; Ord. No. 4470-2015, § 3, 4-6-15) 
Sec. 8-7-4. - Drug, chemical or paint stores (wholesale). 
A.  Definition. 
1.  The term "wholesale" is hereby defined to mean, except where specifically given a different meaning, sales for the purpose of resale, or for use by manufacturers, contractors, trades, railroads, public service corporations and institutions, or for the supplying of branch or general establishments from a central depot or store. 
2.  The term "wholesale drug, chemical, or paint store" is hereby defined to mean any building, room, place or establishment where any chemicals, paints, and oils, or any medicines, drugs, therapeutic preparations, druggists' sundries, physicians' supplies, chemicals, or other articles are sold, offered for sale, or kept with the intention of selling, at wholesale, in the city. 
B.  License Required. No person shall operate or conduct any wholesale drug, chemical or paint store without having obtained a license therefor. 
C.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Code Enforcement and Fire Department. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-7-5. - Filling stations. 
A.  Definitions. 
1.  Filling Station shall mean any building, structure, premises, enclosure, or other place within the Village where a container or containers, tank or tanks, either portable or stationary, and containing other, carbon bisulfate, gasoline, naphtha, benzol, hydrocarbon (gas drips), liquified petroleum gas, acetone, kerosene, turpentine or other flammable liquids having a flash point below 165 degrees Fahrenheit are kept or located for the purpose of selling, offering for sale or distributing any such liquids from such container or tank; provided, however, that the provisions of this Article shall not apply to hardware stores, paint stores or any place where such flammable liquids are kept or sold for medicinal purposes only. 
2.  Full Service Station shall mean a filling station wherein an employee dispenses materials as set forth in A.1. above at all pumps. 
3.  Secured Self-Service Station shall mean a filling station wherein the customer may dispense the materials as set forth in A.1. above at one or more pumps but that the licensee employee an attendant on the dispensing island at all times or operates a pre-payment system or other theft elimination security system approved by the Police Department. 
4.  Non-Secured Self-Service Station shall mean a filling station wherein the customer may dispense the materials as set forth in A.1. above at one or more pumps and the licensee fails to employ an attendant on the dispensing island at all times or fails to operate a pre-payment system or fails to implement any other theft elimination security system approved by the Police Department. 
B.  License Required . No person shall engage in the business of a filling station without having obtained a license therefor. 
C.  Signs Required. No person shall engage in the business of a secured self-service station or non-secured self-service station without having posted a sign visible from the adjacent highway in the form prescribed by the Public Works Department indicating whether the station will dispense the materials as set forth in A.1. above at one or more pumps to a physically handicapped person, senior citizen or other person who is unable to safely dispense motor fuel into that person's vehicle. For purposes of this section, the vehicle of such person must display handicapped registration, disabled veteran registration, or governmental issued handicapped designation or such person shall present identification showing age of 65 or more. 
D.  Emergency Phone Service. No person shall engage in the business of a filling station without providing a public telephone or if none available, access to a private telephone where there is a threat to public health or public safety necessary to be reported to the public authority. 
E.  Public Restroom Required. No person shall engage in the business of a filling station without providing for a public restroom during hours of operation. 
F.  Driveways Clear. No person shall engage in the business of a filling station without providing for storage or parking of vehicles away from the public right-of-way including parkways and driveway aprons. 
G.  Landscaped Interior Clear. No person shall engage in the business of a filling station without providing for shielding of view of refuse or trash containment area. 
H.  Repealed. 
I.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Code Enforcement and the Fire Department. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-7-6. - Firearms, airguns and explosive toys. 
A.  It is intended that this Section shall pre-empt all Cook County licensing or other regulatory schemes for firearms, and firearms dealers. As provided in Article VII, Section 6(c) of the State of Illinois Constitution of 1970, if a county ordinance conflicts with an ordinance of a municipality, the municipality ordinance shall prevail within its jurisdiction. 
B.  It is specifically intended that this Section shall pre-empt the Cook County Firearms Dealer's License Ordinance as now in effect or as may be hereafter amended, and the Cook County Assault Weapons and Assault Ammunition Ban Ordinance as now in effect or as may be hereafter amended. 
C.  License Required. No person shall engage in the business of selling, or to commercially sell, loan or give away to any person within the Village, any pistol, revolver, derringer, shotgun, rifle or other weapon of like character without securing a license so to do. 
D.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Police Department. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-7-7. - Florists, greenhouses. 
A.  Definitions. 
1.  Florist shall mean any building, room, stand, enclosure, premises, place, establishment, or part of establishment in the Village of Hoffman Estates operated, maintained, or conducted for the sale, or offering, or keeping for sale at wholesale or retail, any flowers, plants, trees or shrubs, including Christmas trees, of all varieties and description. 
2.  Greenhouse shall mean any building or room constructed principally of glass or other similar transparent material, used, operated or maintained for the purpose of raising or growing any flowers, plants, trees or shrubs for sale, either at wholesale or retail, wherein artificial heat is used to stimulate or promote the growth processes. 
B.  License Required. No person, firm or corporation shall manage, conduct, operate or carry on the business of florist without having obtained a license therefor. 
C.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Code Enforcement. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-7-8. - Fuel oil storage stations. 
A.  Definition. "Fuel Oil Storage Station" shall mean any building, structure, premise, enclosure or other place within the Village wherein are kept a container or containers, tank or tanks, either portable or stationary, for the receiving or storage of fuel oil for sale either at wholesale or retail, where the total storage capacity is not less than 1,000 gallons. 
B.  License Required. No person shall engage in the business of operating or maintaining a fuel oil storage station without having obtained a license therefor. 
C.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Code Enforcement and the Fire Department. 
D.  Self-Service Regulations. The applicant shall comply with the current regulations of the State Fire Marshall and the Illinois Department of Law Enforcement. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-7-9. - Going out of business sale. 
A.  Statutory Compliance. A "Going out of Business Sale" shall be conducted in compliance with the Fraudulent Sales Act, 815 ILCS 350/01 et seq. 
B.  License. It shall be unlawful to conduct a "Going out of Business Sale" as defined by 815 ILCS 350/2 without obtaining a license therefore. 
C.  Application. An application shall contain the requirements of 815 ILCS 350/14, "Application for License - Contents - Inventory". 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-7-10. - Hardware and paint stores. 
A.  License Required. It shall be unlawful for any person to sell or offer for sale at retail of any of the following articles: hardware, tinware, household appliances; aluminumware; enamelware; jewelry; cutlery; tools; implements; apparatus; machinery; plumbing; engineers; janitors'; blacksmiths'; contractors'; or electrical supplies; gas, plumbing or electrical fixtures; other articles or wares made largely of metals; kerosene, paints; and loaded shot shells or cartridges where not more than 25,000 are kept on hand at one time; without first having obtained a license therefor. 
B.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Code Enforcement including the right of inspection before licensing. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-7-11. - Junk dealers. 
A.  License Required. It shall be unlawful for any person to buy, or offer to buy, barter or exchange, at retail, any junk, rags, paper or bagging, old metal, empty bottles, slush or lead while traveling from place to place, in, along or upon the streets or alleys of this Village, without having obtained a license therefor as is hereinafter provided. 
B.  Stolen Goods. Every junk dealer who shall receive or be in possession of any goods, article or things of value which may have been lost or stolen, shall upon demand produce such article or things to any member of the Police Department for examination. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-7-12. - Machine shops. 
A.  Definition. "Machine Shop" shall mean a work shop in which machines are made or parts thereof are repaired or where parts of machines or tools, wood, implements, dies, gears, screws, tin or metal or other articles are cut, filed, shaped, punched, stamped, planed, sawed or repaired by means of a lathe, drill, punch, saw, planer or other machinery. 
B.  License Required. No person shall conduct or operate a machine shop as defined in this Article within the limits of the Village of Hoffman Estates without having obtained a license therefor. 
C.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Code Enforcement. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-7-13. - Resale business. 
A.  Definition. 
1.  Resale Business shall mean every person in the Village of Hoffman Estates that is engaged in the business of receiving or purchasing second-hand goods for money, legal tender or in trade for other merchandise from any person other than the licensed manufacturer, vendor or distributor, having the intent to trade, sell or otherwise transfer or exchange those second-hand goods for value. 
2.  Second-hand goods shall mean articles of personal property previously owned or used by any person other than the manufacturer, vendor or distributor, including but not limited to antiques and collectibles, artwork, electronics, bicycles, cameras, computers, electronic toys, games and software, musical instruments, cellular telephones, precious metals and stones, power tools, and trading cards and memorabilia. Excluded from application of this Section 8-7-13-A-2 are articles of clothing and large furniture. 
3.  Precious metals and stones shall mean any articles of personal property containing precious metals, including but not limited to silver, gold and platinum, such as, but not limited to, commemorative coins or other articles of memorabilia, United States or foreign currency and any articles containing any genuine diamond, ruby, emerald, sapphire or pearl of any value and any other genuine stone or gem having a value of more than One Hundred Dollars ($100.00). 
B.  License Required. It shall be unlawful for any person to engage in the business of receiving or purchasing for money, legal tender or in trade for other merchandise second-hand goods from any person other than the licensed manufacturer, vendor or distributor, with intent to resell without first obtaining a Resale Business license therefor from the Village for each separate place, premise or location where such Resale Business is to be conducted, except that this Section 8-7-13 shall not apply to vehicles registered pursuant to the Illinois Vehicle Code, 629 ILCS 5/1 et seq. 
C.  Record Requirements. All Resale Businesses shall subscribe to and participate in the LeadsOnline web-based record keeping system and for that purpose shall maintain a computer system with internet access sufficient to use the Leads Online service. Any outage or failure relative to the Resale Business's computer system shall not excuse the Resale Business from the requirements of this Section 8-7-13-C. 
Every article that is a second-hand good within the meaning of this Section 8-7-13-A-1 that is deposited with or received by a Resale Business shall be entered into the LeadsOnline database on a daily basis by the Resale Business and shall include at a minimum the time and date the article was purchased or received by the Resale Business; the serial number, make, model and description of the article; the amount of money or tender paid by the Resale Business for the article; the name, date of birth, telephone number, sex and residence address of the person selling or exchanging the article; a digital color photograph of the form(s) of identification presented by the person selling or exchanging such article with the Resale Business; and digital color photographs showing any serial numbers or other identifying marks. No Resale Business shall purchase, sell or exchange any article that is a second-hand good within the meaning of Section 8-7-13-A-2 from which the original manufacturer's serial number has been removed, altered or obliterated. 
In the event the LeadsOnline system is not operational, the Resale Business shall, during that time, be required to keep written records of any and all purchases, sales and/or exchanges of second-hand goods to include all information required by this Section. Such written records shall be open and available for review upon request by any member of the Police Department during regular business hours. 
D.  Identification. Every Resale Business shall require two forms of identification to be shown by each person selling or trading any second-hand goods to the Resale Business, or buying items received by the Resale Business for resale and/or exchange. One of the two forms of identification shall be a valid driver's license or identification card issued by a governmental entity which must include such person's address and photo. 
No Resale Business or its agent or employee shall accept or receive any second-hand goods from any person under the age of eighteen (18) years without a written consent signed by the minor's parent or legal guardian in the presence of the Resale Business licensee, or from any person appearing to be intoxicated or under the influence of any drug or controlled substance, or known to the resale business to have been convicted of theft, burglary, deceptive practices, robbery or armed robbery. 
E.  Inspection. No second-hand goods received by the Resale Business from any person for money, legal tender or in trade for merchandise shall be sold by the Resale Business or removed from the Resale Business's place of business for a period of seven (7) days after entry of the required information into the LeadsOnline database by the Resale Business, but during that period shall be open and available for inspection upon request by any member of the Police Department during regular business hours. 
All computer generated records and reports, including copies of all forms of identification and digital photographs of the property received by the Resale Business shall be maintained for a period of three (3) years after the date of which the record was prepared and open and available for inspection by the Police Department. 
F.  Duty to Report Stolen or Lost Property . Each Resale Business or its agent or employee shall promptly report to the Police Department any property presented to the Resale Business for sale or exchange with the Resale Business, if the Resale Business or its agent or employee reasonably believes that the property was stolen or that the property was lost and found by the person attempting to sell or exchange it with the Resale Business. 
G.  Return of Stolen Property. When any person is found to be the owner of stolen property which has been received or purchased as a second-hand good by any resale business, such second-hand property shall be seized by the Police Department and returned to its owner, or held as evidence, subsequent to any criminal prosecution, without the payment of money or legal tender to the Resale Business for any costs or charges of any kind which the Resale Business may have incurred. 
H.  Regulations. All Resale Businesses shall comply with this Section 8-7-13, and with all applicable State laws and this Municipal Code, including Code Enforcement and Police Department. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11; Ord. No. 4376-2013, § 1, 6-17-13) 
Sec. 8-7-14. - Solicitors. 
A.  Definitions. 
1.  Soliciting shall mean and include any one or more of the following activities: 
a.  Seeking to obtain orders for the purchase of goods, wares, merchandise, foodstuff, services of any kind, character, or description, or whatever, for any kind of consideration whatever; 
b.  Seeking to obtain prospective customers for any application of purchase of insurance of any type, kind or character. 
c.  Seeking to obtain subscriptions to books, magazines, periodicals, newspapers, or any other type or kind of publication; or 
d.  Seeking to obtain gifts or contributions of money, clothing or other valuable thing for the support or benefit of any charitable or non-profit association, organization, corporation or project. 
2.  Residence shall mean and include every separate living unit occupied for residential purposes by one or more persons, contained within any type of building or structure. 
3.  Business shall mean and include every enterprise licensed under this Article 8. 
4.  Registered Solicitor shall mean and include any person who has obtained a valid certificate of registration, as hereinafter provided, and which certificate is in the possession of the solicitor on his or her person while engaged in soliciting. 
B.  License Required. Every person desiring to engage in soliciting as herein defined from persons in residences or businesses located in Hoffman Estates is hereby required to make written application for a license. A corporation may make application for minors if the solicitation is on behalf of a not-for-profit corporation. 
C.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Police Department before license shall be issued. 
D.  Village Policy on Soliciting. It is hereby declared to be the policy of the governing body of this municipality that the occupant or occupants of any residence or business located within the Village of Hoffman Estates shall make a determination of whether solicitors shall be or shall not be invited to their respective residence or business. 
E.  Notice Regulating Soliciting. Every person desiring to secure the protection intended to be provided by the regulations pertaining to soliciting contained in this Code shall comply with the following directions, to wit: 
Notice of the determination by the occupant of the refusal of invitation to solicitors to any residence or business, shall be given by displaying a card upon or near the main entrance door to the residence or business, containing such language as: 
"NO SOLICITORS" 
"NO SOLICITORS INVITED" 
or such other language as would indicate that solicitors are not to enter or engage in solicitation on the premises. 
Such card so exhibited shall constitute notice to any solicitor of the determination by the occupant of the residence or business of the information contained thereon. 
F.  Duty of Solicitors. It shall be the duty of every solicitor upon going onto any premises in the Village upon which a residence or business, as herein defined, is located, to first examine the notice provided for in Sub-Section E if any is attached, and be governed by the statement contained thereon. If the notice states "No Solicitors", or "No Solicitors Invited", then the solicitor shall immediately and peacefully depart from the premises. 
Any solicitor who has gained entrance to any residence or business, whether or not invited, shall immediately and peacefully depart from the premises when requested to do so by the occupant. 
G.  Uninvited Solicitors Prohibited. It is hereby declared to be unlawful and shall constitute a nuisance for any person to go upon any premises and ring the doorbell upon or near any door, or create any sound in any other manner, calculated to attract the attention of the occupant of such residence or business, for the purpose of securing an audience with the occupant thereof, and engage in soliciting, as herein defined, in defiance of the notice exhibited at the residence or business in accordance with the provisions of Subsection E of this Code. 
H.  Time Limit on Soliciting. It is hereby declared to be unlawful and shall constitute a nuisance for any person to go about any premises and ring the doorbell, or rap or knock upon any door, or create any sound in any other manner calculated to attract the attention of the occupant of such residence for the purpose of securing an audience with the occupant thereof, and engage in soliciting as herein defined prior to 10:00 a.m. or after 8:00 p.m. of any weekday, prior to 10:00 a.m. or after 6:00 p.m. on Saturday, or at any time on a Sunday or on a State or National holiday, except that a not-for-profit may solicit from 10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. on a Sunday. 
I.  False Statements or Misrepresentations. No person or organization engaged in solicitation shall misrepresent the purpose of his solicitation or use any false, deceptive or misleading misrepresentation to induce a sale or contribution, or use any plan, scheme or ruse which misrepresents the true status or mission of the person making the call. 
J.  Penalties. Any person or organization engaged in solicitation who commits an offense under this Chapter shall be fined not less than One Hundred Dollars ($100.00) nor more than Five Hundred Dollars ($500.00) for each offense. Prior violations shall be considered valid cause to deny subsequent license applications. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11; Ord. No. 4346-2012, § 1, 12-17-12; Ord. No. 4556-2016, § 2, 8-15-16) 
Section 8-7-15. - Tobacco or electronic smoking device dealers. 
A.  Definitions. 
1.  "Tobacco Product" means any substance containing tobacco leaf, including but not limited to, cigarettes, cigars, pipe tobacco, snuff, chewing tobacco or dipping tobacco. 
2.  "Electronic Smoking Device" means a device as defined by applicable state or federal laws, rules or regulations, which device is capable of providing nicotine through vapor or inhalation. 
B.  License Required. It shall be unlawful for any person to sell any Tobacco Product or Electronic Smoking Device as defined herein in this Section 8-7-15, within the Village without first obtaining a Tobacco Product or Electronic Smoking Device dealer's license as herein provided. 
C.  Regulations. Each Licensee shall comply with all applicable state and federal laws, rules and regulations and this Municipal Code, including its Clean Indoor Air Ordinance and the Code Enforcement and Police Departments, including sub-section 8-7-15-E of this Municipal Code. 
D.  License Revocation. The business license of any Tobacco Product or Electronic Smoking Device Dealer issued pursuant to this Section 8-7-15 shall be revoked upon a third conviction or finding of liability under Section 7-2-2-A-3 in any one twelve (12) month period. 
E.  Certain Free Distributions Prohibited. It shall be unlawful for any Tobacco Product or Electronic Smoking Device Licensee or any person in the business of selling or otherwise distributing, promoting or advertising Tobacco Products or Electronic Smoking Devices, or for any employee or agent of any such Licensee or person, in the course of such Licensee's or person's business, to distribute, give away or deliver Tobacco Products or Electronic Smoking Devices free of charge to any person in any place of public assembly upon public property, including any right-of-way, park, playground or other property owned by the Village, any school district, any park district, any public library or any private property licensed by the Village for an amusement or concert. This Section does not prohibit the distribution of coupons included in newspapers, magazines or other publications. 
(Ord. No. 4445-2014, § 6, 9-15-14) 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 4445-2014, § 6, adopted Sept. 15, 2014, amended § 8-7-15 in its entirety to read as herein set out. Former § 8-7-15 pertained to tobacco dealers, and derived from Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), adopted May 2, 2011. 
Sec. 8-7-16. - Items designed or marketed for use with cannabis or drugs. 
A.  License Required. It shall be unlawful for any person or persons as principal, clerk, agent or servant to sell any items, effect, paraphernalia, accessory or thing which is designed or marketed for use with illegal cannabis or drugs, as defined by Illinois Compiled Statutes, without obtaining a license therefor. Such licenses shall be in addition to any or all other licenses held by applicant. 
B.  Applicant. Application to sell any item, effect, paraphernalia, accessory or thing which is designed or marketed for use with illegal cannabis or drugs shall, in addition to requirements Section 8-1, be accompanied by affidavits by applicant and each and every employee authorized to sell such items that such person has never been convicted of a drug-related offense. 
C.  Persons under 21. It shall be unlawful to sell or give items as described in Section 8-7-16-A in any form to any person under 21 years of age. 
D.  Records. Every licensee must keep a record of every item, effect, paraphernalia, accessory or thing which is designed or marketed for use with illegal cannabis or drugs which is sold and this record shall be open to the inspection of any police officer at any time during the hours of business. Such record shall contain the name and address of the purchaser, the name and quantity of the product, the date and time of the sale, and the licensee or agent of the licensee's signature, such records shall be retained for not less than two years. 
E.  Regulations. The applicant shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Code Enforcement and the Police Department. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11; Ord. No. 4690-2018, § 4, 10-1-18) 
Sec. 8-7-17. - Seasonal outdoor sales. 
A.  Definition. "Seasonal Outdoor Sales" shall mean outdoor sales held upon property not otherwise designated or approved for such sales by the Village Board upon review of Planning and Zoning Commission recommendations. 
B.  License Required . No property owner shall permit and no person shall conduct a seasonal outdoor sale without having obtained a license therefore and the Clerk shall not issue a license without a location approved by the Director of Community Development. Such license shall be issued to the owner of the property and the person conducting the seasonal outdoor sale. 
C.  Requirements. The property owner and/or the retailer shall apply for such license and the license shall be granted only upon compliance with the following requirements: 
1.  No license shall be issued for seasonal outdoor sales on a property less than five acres in size. 
2.  No license shall be issued for seasonal outdoor sales on a property that is not already zoned and approved for retail sales use. 
3.  No license shall be issued for seasonal outdoor sales where the seasonal sales item are not related to the retail categories of the approved retail sales use. 
4.  No license shall be issued for seasonal outdoor sales of items of a non-organic nature. 
5.  No license shall be issued for seasonal outdoor sales upon any property for more than one time per year without approval by the Village Board. 
6.  No license shall be issued for seasonal outdoor sales upon any property for more than a 45-day period without Planning and Zoning Commission review and approval by the Village Board. 
D.  Regulations. The applicant(s) shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Department of Code Enforcement and Fire Department, including the right of reasonable inspection. 
(Ord. No. 4238-2011, § 3(Exh. A), 5-2-11) 
Sec. 8-7-18. - Farmer's/flea market. 
A.  License required. No property owner shall permit and no person shall conduct a farmer's market, flea market, bazaar, swap meet or other similar use where vendor(s) sell fresh produce, prepared foods, plants, new, used or secondhand goods, or other items without having obtained a license therefore and the Clerk shall not issue a license unless the location is approved by the Assistant Village Manager-Development Services. Such license shall be limited to the approved location and shall be issued to the owner of the property and the person conducting the farmer's/flea market. 
B.  Requirements. The property owner and/or the operator shall apply for such license and the license shall be granted only upon compliance with the following requirements: 
1.  No license shall be issued for a farmer's/flea market on a property that is not already zoned and approved for such use. 
C.  Regulations. The applicant(s) shall comply with all applicable regulations of the Division of Code Enforcement, Police Department and Fire Department, including the right of reasonable inspection. 
(Ord. No. 4181-2010, § 2, 5-17-10) 
Sec. 8-7-19. - Garage sales. 
A.  Definitions . For the purposes of this Section, the following definitions shall apply unless the context clearly indicates or requires a different meaning: 
1.  Directional Sign . Any sign offering directions to the sale premises and located other than on the sale premises. 
2.  Permit Sign . The Permit Sign issued by the Village of Hoffman Estates designating the locating and dates of the sale. 
3.  Garage Sale . The sale of goods, wares and merchandise commonly known as Garage Sales or yard sales conducted on an infrequent and unscheduled basis. The term "Garage Sale" includes all general sales to the open public, conducted from a residential premises, for the purpose of disposing personal property. Bulk sales, the sale of multiple new items of the same description and the sale of consigned merchandise, merchandise brought to the premises for resale or for reconditioning for resale are prohibited. 
B.  Time Limitations . It shall be unlawful for any person to conduct or allow the conducting of a Garage Sale as it is defined herein on premises zoned or used for residential purposes on any day except Thursday, Friday, Saturday, or Sunday, or to conduct more than three (3) such Garage Sales on the same premises, by the same household, within any twelve (12) month period of January 1 through December 31. Each Garage Sale may be up to four (4) consecutive days. It is further provided that no Garage Sale, as defined herein, shall begin before 8:00 a.m. nor continue later than 6:00 p.m. 
C.  Limitation on Display of Goods . A person who is conducting a Garage Sale as defined herein may place on display any goods, wares, merchandise under the provisions of this chapter up to the front property line. Such displays may not extend beyond the property line or into the public right-of-way. 
D.  Permit Required . It shall be unlawful for any person to conduct or allow the conducting of a Garage Sale as defined herein on premises zoned or used for residential purposes without first obtaining a Village permit to conduct such a sale. The request for a Garage Sale Permit shall be made in person, over the telephone or online to the Development Services Department. If a sale is conducted without a permit, the Development Services Department may issue an "on site" permit for the fee set in Section 8-2-1 of the Hoffman Estates Municipal Code at a cost of $10.00. A permit may be issued to a homeowner's association and all listed addresses in the permit application would be permitted to conduct a Garage Sale under one (1) permit. The Garage Sale permit shall be issued in the form of a Village issued Garage Sale Permit Sign which must then be prominently displayed on a window facing the front lawn or on the front lawn of the premise covered by the permit in such a manner as to be visible to persons passing by the premises. The Garage Sale Permit Sign shall be prominently displayed during all operating hours of the sale. 
E.  House Sign Limitations .
